Reviews.Title: “Definite stay when in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LeamBull
Reviews.Content: Recently returned after 4 nights at this hotel for my wedding anniversary. I simply cannot fault it. A great location - walking distance of the K'Damm and KadeWe and overlooking the Tiergarten (our 7th floor room looked out over the zoo). Impeccable service, very nicely furnished, quiet, clean, everything functioned. Breakfast buffet was busy but plentiful and very good. I would have no hesitation in returning. It is a bit of a walk to the nearest U'Bahn stations but only about 10 minutes so not a big deal - buy why bother when the 200 bus stops almost outside and goes straight to Unter Den Linden and Alexanderplatz? It runs every 10 minutes or so and takes about 15 minutes to Mitte. But a Berlin Welcome travel pass and you can go by bus or U or S-Bahn as often as you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Avenelll
Reviews.Content: I don't think you could beat this hotel. The place is immaculate top to bottom. The staff attentive and friendly. The breakfast is outstanding with a multitude of choice. The room was clean and very comfortable with a fantastic view across the zoo opposite. Luxury bathroom and toiletries provided with little touches like a mini nail file and sewing kit in your room. Free internet access is provided in a quiet room on the 2nd floor. Once you get your bearings you'll find the hotel is reasonably central. The staff are very helpful and you can buy travel tickets in reception. There is a huge shopping centre 5 minutes away if that is your thing, plus in the opposite direction and nearby are cafes, chemists, supermarket and a market selling the wonderful breads available in Germany. Berlin is a great city with such friendly locals; even those who don't speak English help with a smile. Wonderful place and what better than to experience it at this hotel? I simply cannot fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: udigold1
Reviews.Content: A year passed by, and me and my wife have returned to Berlin (after a trip to the Black forest), and to the Pullman hotel. The hotel was very busy as it was Easter weekend, but nonetheless it has remained a great hotel, with comfortable room and a bed (I want it in my bedroom!), staff was very lovely and helpful, breakfast was yummy and all in all this hotel rocks! Keep up with the good job! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Emma V
Reviews.Content: The hotels appearance when you walk through the doors is impressive in the foyer area. Staff cant do enough to help you and are happy to offer friendly advice on things such as where to eat in the city, what sights to visit etc. Our room was magnificent with a huge bed and loads of space. The breakfast in the morning was excellent and one night we had a meal in the hotel restaurant which was 1st class. The cleanliness and overall appearance and decor is lovely and the spa facilities also very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An impressive stay for a wheelchair users”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Lynch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Schweizerhof for three nights with our nephew, a twelve year old who uses a wheelchair. It was a great base for our stay, made all the better but the excellent staff whose support could not have been better. We had a stylish accessible room with an extra bed put in. With all three beds it was fine for us although someone in a powered chair might have found it cosier. The accessible bathroom was excellent with great facilities and plenty of manoeuvring room. My nephew also said the put up bed was way better than normal with a proper and very comfortable mattress. Staff were really helpful, all speaking excellent English, and the concierges were very helpful phoning restaurants for us, some we had chosen and one they recommended, and checking out access for us. Overall we would definitely recommend this to anyone with a mobility problem and indeed to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: daisy w
Reviews.Content: An average hotel for a good price. Booking the hotel though to have found a bargain, but the Pullman is not up to the usual 5 star standards. I regularly stay in hotels for work which are usually 4-5 star. I feel Pullman is between a 3 and 4 star. Nothing fancy just a normal chain hotel. So only 2 dots for the fact that it is rated a 5 star though it is absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location with a few niggles”
Reviews.Author: ErikaManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent rate for our four night stay at this hotel. The location is excellent, just a few minutes walk from the station at the Zoo and the train from the airport takes you straight into this station where there is also an S Bahn train and an underground station. The 200 bus stop is just a few yards from the hotel and I recommend this rather than the tourist bus for sightseeing as it goes past all the main sights (as does the 100 on the opposite side of the city which stops at the other end of the road). We arrived at midday and early check in was no problem. The room was clean and very comfortable - though we didn't have a room facing the zoo but this wasn't a problem for us. The breakfast is excellent with the full range of hot and cold food and coffee service at your table. The reception staff and concierge were very helpful and couldn't be faulted. We didn't use the spa or pool so can't comment. My only niggles were that the room was very warm at night and the air conditioning didn't seem to help - and was actually a bit noisy. The other problem was that there is no free internet. When we asked we were told that it was 9 euro per day. We actually followed previous advice on this page and went to Cafe Minouche across the road and for the price of a couple of coffees were able to take advantage of their free internet service. Would I stay here again? Most definitely. For value and location it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “High on ecfficiancy and comfort, low on ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Anne22594
Reviews.Content: I advise only rooms facing the zoo (for tourists), take the "free" internet ( you pay for it, only in advance, which gives you a relaxed stay), only high floors. this is done via their "bussiness plan, or call hotel to ask. Excelant service, nice design, very comfortable.Great breakfast. On the weaker points: nothing special as far as atmosphere Location: very convenient but not anything special. It was less touristy than other parts and close to a lot of good shops if you are interested in shopping. Go to Savigny Plaz for resturants (rent a bike!!!), try the nice cafe across the street- Cafe Minouch for a quick coffe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: YossiAzoulay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights this week, the first time in this hotel in Berlin. Rooms very comfortable, functional, clean, modern architecture. Very comfortable beds. Breakfast is very rich, dining room staff services with a lot of attention to detail. Strict management of the dining room brings the desired result is always the buffet seems like now he was held for the guests and nothing is missing. The hotel has a spa with heated indoor pool, sauna and fitness room, we enjoyed very much being in the spa, cleanliness, arrangement and calm atmosphere in place. The Hotel is locatde near the Zoo, 10 minutes walk to the main shopping area and to the mail bus station. bus line 200 in front of the hotel can take you to the main atractions in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: tunafishOslo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well sized and quiet, and comfortable beds. Nice pool, nice bar. The hotel is located in a quiet street/area, maybe a little bit boring. About 5-7 minutes to the U-bahn, close to shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof”
Reviews.Author: lawrenceEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of February, weather was absolutely freezing. Hotel was fantastic; had a room with views over the Zoo. ,Rooms were nicely furnished and warm, provided tea/coffee making facilities and gorgeous toiletries. Breakfast was the best I have ever eaten; brilliant choice; the scrambled eggs and dried strawberries were gorgeous. Pool was a little cold but ok once in . Staff were very friendly and helpful, an issue with the room safe was dealt with promptly. Got a brilliant room rate through Thomas Cook. Berlin is a great place, did most of the main tourist attractions. At night went to friendly local bar on Savignyplatz called Zwie & Elfisch and also ate at Andra Luica ; gorgeous food and they gave us a couple of free drinks as we were there for my Partner.s Birthday. I hope to return to Berlin in the summer months and would defiantly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for 3”
Reviews.Author: mina k
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a girl's trip to berlin and we loved it so much. the room was huge and the bathroom was simply luxurious with plenty of room to do ballet if you wanted and a bath with jets and lavendar salts. the concierge(s) were lovely, especially ringo. they helped us find everything we wanted in the city. even the minibar was free and restocked each night! we had an absolutely grand time.. the only thing i could possibly complain about is the broken wifi. unfortunately it was the weekend and they couldn't call anyone to fix it. but there are plenty of others places in berlin you can get your wifi on.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: Carl2009
Reviews.Content: it's cheap, but then again so is any other 5 star hotel in that area. Feel it lacks too much to be a 5 star. Small (but comfortable) beds, big room, very small shower. Nothing special, any 3 star big chain is equally good. We had to stay in the south building, which is about 5 minutes from the main building. I hope it it just the rooms over there that are not that great, otherwise I do not understand all the raving reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tourist11111
Reviews.Content: This is no way near a 5 star, rooms are way too basic. Bed too small, even à double bed is actually a bed for 1,5. Shower is very small and hot water is not consistent. No free wifi, no where in the building, not even lobby!! We had much hope going here looking at the reviews, but we will not come back for sure. If this is the standard for a 5 star accor it is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, but no charm”
Reviews.Author: 12shoes
Reviews.Content: A very fancy hotel with a very impressive breakfast and wonderful rooms. The location is good for shopping and the park next door is a good place to go jogging. The downsides are that they charge for wifi (which annoys me) and the total experience is correct but vaguely soulless. So I would recommend this hotel for couples: the big rooms, the spa and the general ambiance is great for a weekend away. But in reality I would prefer a more charming place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the internet”
Reviews.Author: RNPARIS
Reviews.Content: This is what a modern business hotel should be. Great location, bright decoration, efficient rooms, friendly staff... A top hotel in every respect except for the miserable internet system which just let the property down. Not only does the internet cost €9 per day, but it cuts you off regularly and each time you have to retype 7+5 figure connection codes. Just to rub it in, the hotel system is called 3Connect, yet the first network my Mac picked up every time I opened it was Tmobile, so a change of network was required. I don't even mind paying a modest sum for a good connection, but the need to endlessly re-log onto the system was too much. There you are, a very good hotel with a stay somewhat spoiled by one niggle.

Reviews.Title: “Would give it 'excellent' had they provided free internet..”
Reviews.Author: hloyea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great - without any doubts, but the fact that you still have to pay for internet (while the average room is ~170 euro) is a big disappointment. Really don't get why expensive hotels still charge you for this basic need.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, very friendly staff. and...Gluten free food”
Reviews.Author: weirdo666
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time i stayed at this hotel, this time for fun with my wife. rooms are spacious, nice and new bathrooms. nice swimming pool and a new gym, with 2 bikes, 2 treadmills and 2 cross trainers, some free weights and stuff. what stood out for us this time: - my wife has a gluten allegery, and cant eat bread and stuff - when we told the breakfast staff they immidiately arranged special bread, and the following days had arranged a range of choices very service orientated, which makes me wanna come back here again next year

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself in this excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lozzywozzy
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! I booked breakfast when I booked the room and this turned out to be a great decision. The breakfast buffet included everything you could ever ask for, and a chef to cook eggs, waffles , porridge etc. The room was spotlessly clean, beds comfy and plenty of room. The staff were really helpful and nothing was too much trouble, from storing our bags after checking out, to finding an English/German plug adaptor. It was very near to the big shops and even nearer the zoo and aquarium. The restaurant was excellent but expensive, but the concierge was able to suggest several alternative venues in the local area.The swimming pool was clean and warm, the fitness studio is open 24 hours, and we were able to use the fluffy bathrobes and slippers provided to go down and have a swim when ever we felt like. All in all a perfect experience, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JaneandTim
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this upmarket hotel in Berlin. It is right opposite the Zoo (our room on the eighth floor had fabulous views). We opted for the superior room which was well worth it for the extra space and the mini bar was complimentary (although sadly we only found this out on check out!). The breakfast was amazing, an incredible choice and excellent service. We also had a lovely drink in the bar one evening. And the pool and spa was really great - very relaxing. The location was really nice, not very central, but a lovely walk into the centre via Tiergarten, or a short trip on the U-Bahn. Berlin is a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Everything could have wanted”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bit tricky to find from the U-Bahn but a great hotel. Clean, modern, quiet, great night's sleep, lovely spa, fabulous breakfast, good service. Everything we could have wanted at a competitive price for a European capital

Reviews.Title: “Service management on top!”
Reviews.Author: Traveloholicman
Reviews.Content: it is a hotell managed by Accor and one of their top brands. I have stayed at this hotel for three times on different occasions, both leisure and travel. Just booked a room for my elderly mum and dad on a weekend. Good value for money, nothing execptional but clean, good beds, good functional wifi and a various buffet breakfast with a lot of choices. Best: Really good service at reception, had some issues to solve and they did do everything prompt and with a smile! And a honest smile as well. Not the best: No lounge at hotel, but if de luxe room, you have access to a Nespresso lounge and a espresso machine in room, also free soft drinks in minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pullman for three nights.  I would say it is clean, functional, efficient and comfortable.  I don't really consider the rooms to be of a five star standard, more four star.  They had everything one needed for a short business or leisure stay but are quite small and sparsely decorated. The bathroom is also quite small.  Staff were fantastic. Whether it be the front desk staff or restaurant staff. All were very friendly and efficient and seemed to genuinely be happy to make your stay a pleasant one.   We had breakfast each day and while it is not cheap at 24 euros it was a great spread.  Full selection of hot and continental options as well as eggs/omlette etc made to order. Leisure facilities were quite extensive. It has a great indoor pool (apparently the biggest hotel pool in Berlin) a small but functional gym. And sauna, steam etc. The location was very handy. It is right opposite the Berlin zoo and only five or so minutes walk from several U Bahn metro stations as well as a similar distance from the tegel airport express bus. I would definitely return providing the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, Breakfast is of high quality and great diversity”
Reviews.Author: 3breathed
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night and a day after a trip from Barcelona. I always enjoy this hotel (go there every year around the same time to a meeting). The area is okay, the zoo is right across the street, restaurants can be reached in walking distance. The rooms are very clean, and (quite essential to me) absolutely quiet. But it really is the breakfast I am always looking forward to. Been in so many hotels (including Trump Itl., Chicago and others) this has really one of the best offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsTravelg
Reviews.Content: Good standard modern stylish hotel. Service at reception was very efficient and friendly. We booked a deluxe room, this overlooked the rear courtyard and was very quiet. Free use of mini bar (restocked daily - beers, sparkling wine, soft drinks, water, crips & chocolate) & internet. Very comfortable bed, great sleep quality. Flat screen TV with BBC1/ITV1 & usual English language news channels. Breakfast offered a good choice (both hot & cold). Great swimming pool complex. Location is ideal for Zoo, Tiergarden & KaDeWe. Only about 7 mins walk from U Bahn @ WittenburgerPlatz or Zoo Station. Taxi's always available outside, A great choice in West Berlin

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for resonable prise”
Reviews.Author: ngzarov
Reviews.Content: we stay at delux room. advantages: free wi-fi, free minibar, complementary water, modern furnetur in room and in bathroom, free spa area, nase restaurant, comfortable location, quietly. disadvantages: not good enough to clean the bath, as it turned out surprisingly dry cleaning requires a call to the reception, possible settlement with the children that strange for a business hotel

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: longhaulfromlondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a number of times over the years, most recently in December 2011 on a short business trip. The welcome is always warm, the rooms are well equipped and appointed and spotlessly clean. Breakfasts are good and the variety means you can have something different each day when you are there for a few days. The pool and gym are great, I believe it's the biggest hotel pool in the city and the sauna makes a pleasant stop off as long as you can cope with the German habit of both sexes naked together, it doesn't bother me any more but did seem a little strange at first. The location is great, a short walk from the Zoo Station and it's easy to find a number of restaurants close by in the evenings if you want to eat out. As long as I have to go to Berlin, I think this will remain my prefered choice for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roberderoski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in December with friends. The Hotel is great - clean, modern, comfortable and service is excellent. Staff are friendly, helpful and could not do enough for us. The bar area is small but cosy and very relaxed serving good food and plenty of good beer. Rooms are comfortable, well equipped and the bathrooms were equally as good - spotless and a decent size. We would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melimelo Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and large rooms, quiet and cozy, super clean and very relaxing spa and swimming pool, efficient and friendly staff, ideal situation. Pullman is and remains my favourite place to stay in Berlin !

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mats71
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin during X-mas, between Dec 23rd-Dec 25th and stayed two nights at the Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof. Overall this was an excellent hotel and we can recommend it to anyone that would like a good stay. A few things to notice though: The spa-area is very nice with a large pool and 2 different saunas. As other reviewers have mentioned the sauna area is mixed, i.e. both men and women enjoy the same saunas. However the information about that and rules for "engagement" could be clearer. We had read the reviews prior to our visit and knew to expect naked people of both genders, and as flexible travellers we followed the example of the first gentleman we met in the area and undressed completely. Clearly not everyone had understood the principle which had the consequence that when my girlfriend and I went into the steam sauna we found ourselves in the company of a mother and daughter wearing swimsuits. Lucky enough we had large towels with us so that we could avoid making the other couple more unconfortable. Several other couples did join the sauna and there was a clear confusion regarding the (un-)Dress code. My advice to the hotel management would be to put up larger signs, preferably with pictures, that clearly shows what is expected to wear, and not, in the area. This a side, the sauna was very nice. If you like a spa-treatment then make sure to book it as early as possible in order to get it at a time that is convinient for you - during x-mas, at least, it wasn't too easy to find a suitable slot. Speaking about booking, if you book your stay at the hotel early then you can get a very good discount! My advice is to use this discount, or part of it, to upgrade to a room with free mini-bar, WiFi, and breakfast - it's well worth the few extra Euros, and would be much more expensive if it's bought at the location. We can also recommend the fantastic restaurant at the hotel, excellent service and very very nice menu. Last, but not least, we were unfortunately recommended a poor restaurant for our dinner night out in Berlin, we are absolutely convinced that this was an accident driven by the fact that most restaurants weren't open during x-mas eve, but a good practise would always be to double-check any recommendations on trip-advisor! If we would have done this, then we wouldn't have visited Restaurante Diverso!!!! (please see my separate review of this place) All in all, we would love to visit Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof again! :)

Reviews.Title: “great berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: natanBologna
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a central location in Berlin, close to Zoo Garden and acquarium. Well connected to U-bahn 5 min walk or bus 200 for all main Berliner turistic places, in front of the Hotel. Wery clean large room, with all conforts: you can have mineral water for free and also kettle for coffe/tea. One of the best things is the breakfast. Plenty of food and choice of everything you can imagine. The other good point of the hotel is the Spa. A large swimming pool with relax area, sauna, steam bath, showers and ice at your disposal for get cold after sauna. at the second floor you can find a pc room with free internet connection and printers, so we printed our boarding card at the hotel. Price very good for this kind of hotel...I'll reccomend it for whom wll be in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in an oven...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and well located...BUT we had two terrible nights as the heating in the hotel was very hot and the control in the room give you little to no control on the room temperature, which I think is unthinkable for such an hotel... You can choose from -3 to +3, which doesn't tell me much, and even by putting it on -3, the AC only made more ventilation noise without having much air getting out of the ventilation grid... We informed the reception the first and we were told that they would send someone to fix it... after the second night in the same conditions, we complained again at the checkout... this time we were told that it was due to the exceptionally high temperature for the season (10°C)!?! welcome to the 21st century! Otherwise the hotel was clean very well located and with a very nice modern design

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Mattlang
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been renovated recently and everything ist just wonderful. The reception is very efficient and friendly, the room at beautiful and functional, the breakfast ist scrumptious and the hotel has a lovely SPA and gym area with a big pool. The dinner is a bit on the expensive side, but you pay for what you get. I had the most amazing beef fillet there ever! Staff is extremely attentive and friendly! This hotel gets a firm YES from me!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: chrisgarcia
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin, and the main reason was to visit the Xmas markets, and various WW2 museums, memorials, etc For us this hotel was in a great location. 10 min walk from the Zoo station (although a little confusing which way to go when we first came out the station) and 10 mins to another underground. Both on the U2 line, which was great for us as it pretty much went everywhere we needed to go. In fact, i don't think we used a different tube line in the 4 days we were there. We got the Express train from Schoenfeld airport which was only 35 mins to the Zoo station Deluxe room was spacious, with free mini bar, free Nespresso machine and free WIFI (worked fine with Iphone). All three very handy (although the mini bar wasn't re-stocked one night which was slightly annoying). Nice shower and shower gels/shampoo's etc. Bed was comfy, but was two singles pushed together which seems to be the norm in Germany. Breakfast was very nice. Large selection and good quality. Reception staff very helpful and very good english. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Queenofteddybears
Reviews.Content: A sparkling clean and comfortable hotel. It was cosy and warm.The room and the staff were very helpful and caring. The coffee in the bar area is a treat, served with a solid silver tray and delicious biscuits. The actual restaurant food was very expensive and disappointing though, beware! The swimming pool is wonderful and robes are provided in your room, so you don't need to pack them. You can even have a hot water bottle fetched to your door, if you wish; well why shouldn't you?

Reviews.Title: “Weihnachten schnuppern in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TheHeinles
Reviews.Content: Dear trippers, we visited this hotel from 9th December till 11th December. This hotel is perfectly situated near Die Gedachtniskirche at the famous Kurfurstendamm (about 400 metres). Within a 10 minutes walk you will find the KaDeWe, metrostation Kurfurstendam, Citytourbus stop, and lots of stores. Besides location the hotel itself is important of course. Well, lets be short this time ...Great beds, room, service and the restaurant.. something you expect in a 5 star hotel which is everything :-). Even the swimming pool is recommendable for a short relaxation after a shopping day. There is a parking place under the hotel. A lift takes you right in front of the lobby. Enjoy Berlin like we did fellows. The Heinles

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: andycowdrill
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Berlin in December 2011 and couldnt of wished for a nicer hotel..... great price, fantastic, clean hotel but more importantly the staff were amazing and could not have done more for us during our stay - even recommending two local restaurants that were amazing!! If you are visiting Berlin stay at this Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel perfect- garage a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: doc holiday
Reviews.Content: I agree with all positive reviews about the hotel. Perfect location, nice rooms, friendly service and a very nice breakfast buffet. If you should arrive by car, be warned: The hotel was built in 1999, but the garage must have been constructed fifty years earlier. If your car is bigger than a Mini you will have difficulties getting into a parking space. Going round one of the corners with a full size car deserves your full attention. The walls are covered with marks of the cars that didn´t make it. And if you finally manage to get into the parking lot, you have to show acrobatic skills, to get out of your car .Everything is extremely narrow. They should give a 20 € award for succesfully parking your car instead of charging this amount per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Pullman”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyRichmond Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and it did not disappoint. The service was excellent, even to the extent of being provided with an English Bible on request ( after some confusion with an English bagel, my Scottish accent I think! ). The room facilities were excellent my only complaint being that the temperature was much too hot. We left our windows open 24 hrs otherwise it would have been unbearable. This has been commented on before. Breakfast was excellent. We found the location very convenient with easy transport links everywhere. We very quickly mastered the buses, train and underground. There was a great Christmas market opposite the Zoo not as posh but every bit as good as the Gendarmarket ( ? spelling ) though the one at Charlottenburg was prettier. We had a great time and plan to visit Berlin and the Pullman again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Rooms and Friendly, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: trev1uk
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Pullman at about 10am:- after 6 hours of travelling, I was tired and ready to catch up on some sleep but was worried I wouldn't be able to check-in until the afternoon. I was really pleased to find-out my room was already available and ready to use. The Reception staff were great and really friendly, and that is something I appreciated having been travelling since 3am. The room was spotless and well appointed. I did book via bookings.com and paid the entire cost in advance, but for this you get a better standard of room for your money (and I also got a free mini-bar). On the downside, there was only 1 English TV channel, and wasn't being displayed for some reason. However, I didn't plan on spending too much time in my room so this was a minor issue. Breakfast was good and plentiful. There's a lot of choice:- juices, cold meats, cheese, cereals, yoghurts, hot breakfast items and a short-order omlette counter. The hotel also has a gym and swimming-pool, sauna, steam room and ice-showers. It was never busy and was a great place to relax in the evening. There are other hotels nearby with slightly better facilities if this is what you're looking for, but they are also a lot more expensive. I think the facilities here would meet most people's needs more than well. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Zoologischer Garten S-Bahn, and you can use the Schonefeld Airport express train and be here within 30 minutes for just 3 Euros. The transport connections are easy, quick, cheap and efficient. Would I stay here again? Definately....the quality of the rooms, the facilities, food and very friendly staff, all make this hotel a great place to stay. I wouldn't have to think twice :o)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money - Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: APF72
Reviews.Content: The first point about this hotel is that it represents excellent value for money all round. My wife and I booked in for three nights over the second weekend in December and throughly enjoyed our stay. ROOM: We were given a deluxe room on our check in on the second floor. Overall, it was excellent - extremely clean, bright with modern furnishings. The mini-bar was included in the room price which was a nice touch and while we also had Wi-Fi included. However we did not really need it as there is an excellent business room outside the lift on each floor. One slight negative on the room front was that the lack of English TV stations. LOCATION: The hotel is situated in the West side of the city, close to the 'K'dam' which is one the main shopping areas on Berlin (5 mins walk). Zoo station is also approx a 10 min walk from the hotel which made it convenient from Schonefeld Airport - we caught an Airport Express train which took approx 35 minutes. FOOD: Breakfast was excellent. There was a great choice available at the buffet, from cereals, breads, hot buffet, made to order eggs/omelettes and crepes,cold meats, fruit and pastries. It was one of the highest standard selections that we had experienced in a hotel. The food was constantly stocked and the staff were very quick to provide tea/coffee and refills.The weekend was busy but the room was a good size to cope. SPA: After a short walk to a different wing in the hotel (transfer through 2nd Floor) you can reach the hotel spa which includes a large pool, ideal for lengths. There is also a 'mixed' sauna & steam room area which leads from both changing areas which was an oasis of relaxation. STAFF: We found all the staff were extremely helpful. This included the receptionists, the breakfast staff, the housekeeping staff and the attendees in the spa. All our requests were dealt with true profesionilsm. Overall, I would throughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We all loved it”
Reviews.Author: KJAJ1
Reviews.Content: Give me a fabulous breakfast and a Nespresso machine in the room and you've won me over already. Throw in wonderful service, comfortable beds, rooms big enough to accommodate our family of four and a pool and spa - well! The reviews on this site are really accurate. The hotel is good value for money - 100% recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We had great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DK-NO
Reviews.Content: We went as a group of three girls wanting to enjoy Berlin in December. We chose this hotel because it really offered great value for money. Compared to many other hotels I have stayed in various countries, the rate seems cheap to us, yet the hotel is an astounding five star with great reviews here. We were upgraded to junior suite upon arrival and all the staff had been very helpful. There was little chaos during the breakfast time due to the number of guests and limited seating, but the various choice of breakfast menu quickly covered that up. The only problem we had during our stay was that the wifi internet didn't work. It could be because we stayed too far from the "main area" (our suite was located in the east side of the hotel, we had to walk thru the spa, beauty center and all that to get to our room), but we didn't have internet for 3 days we were there, so we couldn't really browse of possible sightseeing places we wanted to go, but luckily the concierge was super helpful. If I ever go to Berlin again, I would definitely stay here again. No doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “you have to be really picky to find anything wrong”
Reviews.Author: jroberts425
Reviews.Content: I last visited berlin 4 years ago and passed this hotel on my daily sightseeing walks. I think it was a Sofitel back then but is now still the same group but re- branded as a Pullman. It looks imposing and comfortable and being near the zoo was a little more centralled placed than my last hotel if you want to walk out to both the former East and West Berlin. The deal in the deluxe room with complimentary wifi and minibar was well worth it. The wifi is fine and the mini bar stocked with chocolates,crisps and a selection of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks. Given the status of the hotel cleanliness and comfort is a given but I cannot remember stopping in a hotel where all surfaces and glasswear gleamed,lots of chrome and glass and no smears or finger marks anywhere - real attention to detail. The room was kept clean to a similar impeccable standard. The buffet breakfast was excellent,and is open 6:30 to 11 from recollection so it is never too crowded. The spa is beautifully decorated and really relaxing and a decent sized swimming pool. I know this all really repeats what is in the preceding reviews but it is exactly what you get ayt this hotel - I noticed Lufthansa book their pilots in here so I'm sure that speaks volumes. However it is the staff who make the whole experience even better. From checking in - quick,courteous and efficient, to the breakfast staff - friendly and welcoming and the cheerful spa staff you really were made to feel like a special guest - particularly nice when on holiday. Again the check out service was crisply efficient ( they had clearly put extra staff on at an anticipated busy time ) but also personal and friendly. As the title implies it is difficult to say anything negative about this gem of a hotel but if pushed possible improvements would be : 1. Swimming pool temperature increased a degree or two. 2 Corridor temperature decreased a degree or two. 3 Clarification of how/when minibar restocked. 4 Better written instructions for Nespresso machine in room. Otherwise perfect hotel - will definitely stop here again on next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great - best attention ever a big hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luxikarin
Reviews.Content: Staff is really a plus in this hotel which only makes it more enjoyable. Everything is perfect to make an enjoyable stay in Berlin. The location is not my favourite, but this is very personal. With bus nr: 200 just in front you reach all the important spots really easily. And last but not least GREAT swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend getaway hotel for family.”
Reviews.Author: Amurray160
Reviews.Content: Not sure I can add anything more to the well deserved praise that this hotel has received here, but having lived now for over three years in Berlin (well, technically in the suburbs ) I can assure visiting tourists that this is a great location for any trip to Berlin. It is walking distance to Ku'dam shopping and the zoo and also to the central Zoologischer Garten train/S-bahn/U-bahn station which can get you all around the city quickly. The pool was warm (especially compared to most other indoor pool experiences we have survived) and the breakfast passed the kids test with flying colors.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: elxolas
Reviews.Content: We were very much impressed with our stay here! Staff were very courteous: reception, breakfast and housekeeping. We got a choice for room location upon arrival and enjoyed the breakfast banquet very much indeed! Hotel facilities spotless: trendy and sleek. Very pleasant location infront of the Tiergarten. Appreciated the complimentary water in the room and access to four computers with free internet. Shame we didnt manage to check the Spa/Pool. Would definitively repeat. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: crystalone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because of its great location to the zoo and it definitely lived up to our expectations. We arrived a bit stressed out as the airline had lost our bags to be greated by a very nice check in person who had our room key ready in minutes. We were traveling with children so this is very important to us not to be hanging around and waiting and the staff reasured us that as soon as our bags arrived they would send them up to us. We were staying in a suite and it was very clean and big and very well layed out. We were very impressed with the size of the bed and how comfortabe the bed and pillows were. Our windows overlooked the zoo and the children had great fun looking out. We were also very impressed by the extra effort the hotel went to with the extra little touches like a gift for the children which containded colouring books and crayons. The free mini bar was also a nice touch with water, orange juice, wine, beer ect and also nuts and other snacks. When our bags arrive they were brought straight to the room with no fuss. We also used the free internet which was very fast and efficient. We had room service on two nights as the children were to tired to go out and on both nights we were very impressed by the standerds of the food and the service. Everything was presented on a lovely well layed out trolly. With everything we needed. We had pasta for the children and there was parmesan cheese and we had homemade hambergers and there was plenty of salad dressing and sauses. All in all it was so relaxing and just what you wanted for a family trip with no fuss and for the kids to feel happy and well fed. We also used the swimming pool a few times the only criticism was that the temperature of the pool was very very cold and it was hard to enjoy it as we and the children found it to cold to stay in it to long. We had breakfast every morning of our stay and found it to be a very pleasureable experience. There was a huge choice of food on offer from cooked to cold selection with plenty of cold meats and cheeses and pate. There were lots of different breads and little pastries. I found the selection of teas most enjoyable and we always found that the breakfast set us up for the day to go sight seeking. My only criticism was that the self service area was a bit small and could get very crowed when it got busy and sometimes the staff hovered around the tables a bit to much as they needed to turn the tables over quickly as the demand for tables was huge so you felt a bit rushed if it was busy. However all in all we would return and found it a great hotel to visit all the attractions we look forward to returning to it again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Meets your highest expectations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good service, amazing indoor swimming pool, good room cleanliness, good breakfast. For sure a value for money option!! The restaurant is too expensive for the food quality, better to eat on the nearby restaurants where you can find several options less expensive and with better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant friendly staff and a lovely room”
Reviews.Author: alicej1985
Reviews.Content: The staff were a delight, their customer service was superb. The room was lovely and we were brilliantly catered for.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Getitgoing1974
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you expect from Pullman. Very nice rooms, good service, everyone was very friendly. I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Berlin and this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brian G Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof was a great luxury hotel. The rooms were very clean and came with a free bottle of water each day. Upon arriving, we asked if there were any free upgrades and they moved us to the 9th floor for a better view of Tiergarten. The good: it is a really really nice hotel. Definitely 5-star in my opinion. The beds/rooms are clean. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE SPA. It's a great place to jump in the modern swimming pool, or go in the sauna (although Europeans like to get naked in the sauna...buyer beware). The bad: There is no Wi-Fi in the hotel, not even for a charge. How a hotel, especially of Pullman's quality, doesn't have Wi-Fi in 2011 is beyond me. They have a huge conference center....I would hope no conferences are held that need Wi-Fi because it won't happen. I wouldn't stay at Pullman again unless there is Wi-Fi next time. Also, while the hotel is close to KuDamm, it is decently far from all of the other sights of Berlin (Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, remains of the Berlin Wall, Checkpoint Charlie, Holocaust Memorial). At least a bus, subway or cab ride to get to them unless you want to walk 45 minutes. Finally, the concierges didn't seem of any value, giving some bad advice on restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: comfytravel
Reviews.Content: Everything is bright new and stylish. The location is fabulous - on a charming Budapester Strasse, right next to the park on one side, Kurfurstendam on the other, and in between all the attractions of former West and East Berlin. Convenient underground garage, great breakfast, free Internet in the business center - just ask for it. There were two minor problems. First, we had an accessible room for disabled, and the design of the bathroom was pretty bad: shower without ANY walls, curtains, tray, just tiled floor. After shower, it becomes all wet and slippery. Second, it's hard to believe, but the ONLY English channel on TV was Al-Jazeera. They said there was a technical problem to be fixed. Overall, great hotel for reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but BIG”
Reviews.Author: tsirout
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 14.35 and our room was not ready. we were escorted to the cocktail bar and told to order complimentary drinks while we waited for 15 minutes. We were then escorted about 50 meters to a lift which took us to the basement. Then we walked about 200 meters to another lift which took us to the third floor where we were shown our room. For some reason we had been upgraded to a suite with a free mini bar and a sofa and two armchairs in a lovely large room. Breakfast was everything you could desire and we found the staff very friendly and helpful. No complaints!! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5 star property. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: Across the street from the InterConti. Super location and very nicely appointed rooms. They say to have the biggest hotel pool in berlin which is easy to beleive since it is very big and beautiful. Breakfast is good. All in all its a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ouragan1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pullman Schweizerhof Berlin and was very pleased with the facilities. Check-in: Expedited in no time with smiles and confidence from the reception staff. Great can-do attitude. Room: Clean and functional. However windows do not open fully. The bathroom was very standard though. Food: Fantastic, extensive breakfast buffet with great waiting staff who deserve to be praised for their professionalism. Business Centre: Providing internet access for free and laser colour printer. Great to prepare reports Overall, very good value for money with service !

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: Singingsal17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for a business conference for 4 nites. Location if close to airport (Teugel) and not to expensve cab ride from the Mitte area. Gym and pool were excellent as was the staff . Cost was higher than usual as this was one of the conference's co-host hotels. Only complaints that had some internet difficulties in my room and I heard this same issue from some other guests. At time in room wireless connection was not strong and would loose connection at times. If you are on outside of building it is difficult to sleep with any windows open but fine if closed. Also they had limited TV stations (2) for English speaking clietel and did not have even CNN or BBC. Restaurant was very good for luch or dinner and not crowded during our stay. Would proabably choose another hotel for non-business trip closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for a good price”
Reviews.Author: 39JulioS
Reviews.Content: Brand new and elegant designed. The hotel is very centric, a few steps from the zoo. I had a huge room on the top floor with an amazing view over the central park (Tiergarten). We slept with closed windows and it was really quiet but if you like to sleep with open windows take a room facing to the inner courtyard. You can reach the spa in the underground from your room through the lift just wearing swimsuit and bathrobe. There is a huge heated pool, a sauna and a turkish bath. The breakfast was super, really incredible choice and everything good! I didn't need to have a lunch after it. It's also well connected. You can find always a taxi waiting at the door. Or if you want to take a bus to go to the east side, the stop is right there. At walking distance you have the big shopping boulevard (Kurfurstendamm) with the biggest department store of Berlin (KaDeWe). A great option for enjoying this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel, close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: weirdo666
Reviews.Content: Nice, light rooms. new furniture. large bathroom. restaurant is excellent, and the bar is modern. excellent gym with new equipment, as well as a rather large swimming pool. perfect for business trips, probably a bit " cold" for leisure, but then again, very luxurieus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: TripDrug
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and easy, the staff were very friendly. The entrance and reception area are very chic, there are multiple lifts and the floors are attractively decorated. The room was quite small, but very well appointed with modern attractive furniture and a restful decor. The bathroom was also small, but with a great use of space and very well lit. The location is outstanding, near to the zooalogical gardens and the city cenre (K-Dam, Ka De We etc.) Our short weekend break in Berlin was greatly enhanced by this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In short: better than this will be hard to find”
Reviews.Author: TravelGeeks2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this modern, contemporary hotel over the weekend. We got an upgrade from a Classic to a Deluxe room, paid a very reasonable price, incl. breakfast wireless (free, also a nice add on) and found ourselves in a nice, luxurious and relatively spacious room facing the inner courtyard of the hotel on the 9th floor. Very clean, quiet room, nice bathroom, comfortable beds and feather pillows (or, as a choice special "health" pillows), with a Nespresso coffee machine, two duvets (pity that no German hotel seems to provide a nice double duvet rather than two smaller duvets which cannot be tugged tightly at feet end). A centrally located spot for this Accor hotel at Budapester Strasse, not far from the main Berlin attractions. Very extensive and wonderful breakfast in an overall very tastefully designed hotel (even the corridors, not always the most attractive parts of any hotel, are tastefully designed). The reception and concierge are kind and helpful. The hotel has a nice and rather larghe swimming pool and attractive Spa. In summary: simply the best. Want to hear two things that they could improve? Make turn down service a standard service, or, alternatively, ask a guest when checked in, whether they like this service (we do). Obviously this is not standard practice you have to ask for it and big chance if you say "turn down service" the receptionist will not immediately understand what you mean. Last small point where the hotel could improve: assistance with luggage. When we checked out and came to collect our luggage after a bike tour (yes the hotel rents good bikes, a must do in Berlin!) we had to struggle with rather voluminous luggage to the front door, no door men assisting us. But, in general, a superb hotel, better than that will be hard to find in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Relax!”
Reviews.Author: Cereusmonstruosus
Reviews.Content: It was so comfortable staying there, great swimmingpool, quiet rooms which were a joy to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Pullmann Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in aug 2011; our first fist fisit to this hotel. The hotel is located in the heart of the city center of Berlin.So we easily found our way by car and parking just beneatht the hotel was no problem. The personnel was very friendly, the rooms were good with exxcellent beds.. Breakfast not cheap but very good. Recommeded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronn1e
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just returned from a 4 day break in Berlin. We chose the Pullman Schweizerhof because of the reviews on trip advisor and its central location. We certainly were'nt disappointed in any way. The hotel was about 10 mins easy walk from the Zoologischer Garten bus station, X9 bus takes you there for 2.30 euros direct from Tegel airport. The hotel is very modern, spotlessly clean and spacious. Staff were wonderful and those in the concierge extremely helpful, from check in to check out. Stayed on B & B and the buffet breakfasts were great...couldn't ask for more choice or better quality. Rooms very comfortable. We had an early flight on the last morning and was impressed with the continental breakfast table located at reception for those checking out before breakfast started Location...close to the aquarium and zoo..easy access to the Ku'Damm for retail therapy...close to the Tiergarten for Brandenburger Tor and Reichstag. Wouldn't hesitate to return or recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - But now the real extra bits of info you need”
Reviews.Author: Colin355
Reviews.Content: First of all we booked 4 rooms for 8 people, the hotel does not give refunds for a last minute change of information so be aware if like us you have paid 1,300 Eu (about £1,000) you may not get it back if you need to cancel or adjust the booking due to some emergency situation. Make sure your insurance will cover this. The hotel is very well situated, out of the hotel and turn left you will head towards the local township where there are plenty of bars and restaurantes within 10 min walk. There is also a bank just 2 min down the same road if you need cash. Turning left you can pick up the local tourist bus company city hopper. This is really worthwhile so for a small sum you can hop on and off the bus as it takes you to the main attactions of Berlin. Turning right out of the hotel you will come across a greak restaurante just 2 min down the road, this is an excellent place for drinks or a meal on an evening. Just past the restaurante, next to the river right you can pick up boat that takes you round the city for a small euro sum, the trip takes about 2.5 hours but really is fantastic with drinks served on-board - really cool on a nice warm day. Turning left rather than right you follow a wooded path behind the Berlin Zoo complex. This is really cool as you see the animals etc from the riverside viewing inwards (its really a free show), load of birds, animals etc to look at. Brilliant. There is also a river-boat lock nearby with a small bar so you sit and watch the boats passing through the lock. The hotel is fantastic. Really good value for money. Breakfast is served over 3 rooms and caters for anything from 1 to 10 guests on a table. It's really cool to sit outside as we did on our first night with really warm weather, just drinking into the small hours and taking in the street views. Breakfast is a feast, just fill your boots. If you are into a Gym/Swim/Sauna cuture I have a few pieces of advice for you here - this hotel has the largest swimming pool in the area with a host of sauna and steam rooms to tempt you. So OK lets get down to the nitty gritty - first if are going to the gym no problem, go for it. If after your gym session or your swim session you decide to go for a sauna then be aware...both the men's and ladie's changing room may say "change/sauna this way" buty what they really mean is they converge into a massive steam room from which men and women both emerge. In Germany it is NOT the done thing to have anything on when you go sauna, so my advice from this experience is to grab anothe towel from the shef that will be in threre and use it as you 'carpet'. Enter the area, hang up one towel and use the othe to carpet your lay-down spot. From the moment you hang up your towel, you shoud be naked from then on in. The men's changing area and women's changing area converge in this communal area. The area has rooms off with different temperature sauna etc. The communal area also has 'fun showers' where you can shower with forceful showers and have coloured lights flashing etc. This whole area is male/female naked only. Now do not be put off.... ....On entry to the communal area you will see several nakes bodies, men/women, just standing, talking etc - this is normal, just enter any sauna/steam room you want then come out say 10 min later. Dont be afraid you will be showering next to someone from the opposite sex and perhaps going into a splash-pool with them naked in a few minutes time, this is all part of the experience. If you are a guy at this hotel, dont worry about female attendents in your changing room. They will quite often start to clean the floor while you are in the shower, you can have nice chat to them while you try to scrub up. Dont be timid, just act natural and think matcho!!! They will often come into the sauna to add water to the coals for you, just dont worry about it. Overall remember Germans are very private people apart from in their Sauna/Bath-houses where they are very 'free' with their bodies. Just go along with it and you will have a great time!!! ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room”
Reviews.Author: NilsW
Reviews.Content: Located very close to Kurfurstendamm, good room, excellent breadfeast. Parking garage to small, easy to get your car damaged.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl061
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from a three week trip in Europe, with three days in Berlin. I was THRILLED with this hotel! The staff could not have been nicer, from our first to last interaction. The room was spacious, the indoor pool a real oasis, the buffet breakfast was scrumptious, and the apples at the front desk a great touch. The concierge was extremely accommodating. This hotel was the least expensive (of the five hotels we stayed at), but by NO MEANS lacking in ANY WAY. My only wish is that they had Pullman hotels in the States!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Rutger L
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our Berlin city trip so much better. The staff was very friendly, the rooms clean and spacious. We liked the swimming pool and sauna a lot and breakfast was very generous, though quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Modern, Classy Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Traveller3121
Reviews.Content: Five-star corporate hotels are not usually our preferred choice of accommodation, but we got a great deal for our three nights stay from the hotel's web site (50% discount, pay in advance) that we would have been silly not to select this hotel for our stay in Berlin. The hotel looks new and is situated on Budapester Str. close to the Zoological Gardens and the major shopping district (KaDeWe department store and others), supermarkets, restaurants and cafes. Our room was on the seventh floor overlooking the courtyard and was very modern, plenty of room and with all the facilities expected of this class of hotel. A nice bathroom with a bath and shower over bath (take care getting into the shower though) and spotlessly clean. A separate check was made by hotel staff daily to ensure the room was cleaned properly. Expensive mini bar (of course) and tea/coffee making facilities also in the room (a nice surprise) and two bottles of water were provided free of charge. Free WiFi or internet connection was available in the room, but not for free. Actually, the cost was quite expensive, which is disappointing and obviously catering to business people (with company paid expenses) rather than leisure travelers. There is a nice restaurant at the hotel, which was expensive compared to local restaurants. A full buffet breakfast (eggs, crepes etc prepared on request) was included with our room rate and was excellent. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge's desk where you can purchase train tickets and also theater tickets if you are interested. To get around Berlin, the No 200 bus goes down Budapester Str., or you can get the train from the nearest metro (U Bahn) which is Wittenbergplatzl or Zoologischer Garten, both about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Tip for sightseeing; take the No 100 Bus (outside of Zoologischer Garten station) for Euro 2.30 (tickets available from Hotel Concierge) as this bus travels the same routes as the sightseeing buses (but no audio available of course). Overall we had a very enjoyable stay at the Pullman.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: AngeS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for 2 nights in August. We thought the hotel was great and really enjoyed staying there. The location was perfect for us. It seemed to be in the middle of everything that we went to see. The staff were friendly and but a bit slow to serve in the bar area. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The twin room we were allocated was large and well appointed. The breakfast buffet is good but a bit expensive 24 euros. Good selection of fruit, cooked items, breakfast cereal, bread, cold meats and cheese. The bar has happy hour for cocktails between 9pm-10pm. The cocktails were pretty good and there is a wide selection. The food served at the bar was also made to a good standard. We looked at the swimming pool area but didn't use it. The pool is fairly large, very clean and there are loungers around the outside. The fitness area looks onto the pool. It looked well equipped and a good size. I would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good points: location, pool, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Torremaules
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is good to go to and from city center or airport. Bus 200 has stops near the hotel entrance either to center or to Zoologischer Garten. Zoologischer Garten U-bahn is about 800 m to the west, still near Wittenbergplatz U-bahn is about 600 m. to the south. At Zoologischer Garten the X09 bus goes straight to Tegel Airport. We had an offer with breakfast and late checkout included. We asked for a quiet room in an upper level with views to the Zoo (that is to the North). Room has very good sound insulation from street noise. Window is bottom hinged and cannot be fully open. Planes flying up from Tegel can be seen from the window. Bed is huge and very comfortable. Robes and slippers are provided. The wardrobe is quite small for storage for a couple to stay a week long. The design bedside tables are useless with no drawers. Flat TV is quite big, it has way too many channels in German; a good point Italian RAI 1,2,3 are available; missed Catalan TV3 as other local Spanish channels are available as well. An American plug in with 110 voltage is missing, not even one for the razor in the bathroom. Room has tea facilities (kettle, tea bags, instant coffee). You get complimentary bottles of water which are replenished daily, and a jar of varied nuts on arrival. On the bassement, but with natural light, there is the big pool (maybe 20 x 10 m), and the spa (mixed gender) with sauna and steam bath. Admitance to the pool and spa area is done with the room keycard. The only complaint is that at some times there are noisy people and screaming children in the pool or inside the sauna. The convenient long opening hours for the pool, from 06:30 to 22:00, allows plenty of time alternatives to escape that nuisance. There is a small room in the 2nd floor with complementary pcs with free internet connection (e.g. to check in flight and print boarding pass). Breakfast buffet is plentiful, many varied options and excellent quality, with fresh orange juice, real yogurt, eggs cooked on the spot, lots of different sorts of bread, several types of puff pastries, several kinds of soft cheese, several German specialties like liver paste and nurnberger and wiener sausages, etc. I personally missed some sort of hard cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: rolf41
Reviews.Content: very well located in the center of Berlin. Room was great and tidy and the staff was very very friendly.The price value relation is just great. This place is really great and helped to make our stay extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: fozco33
Reviews.Content: spend here a weekend during our citybreak in Berlin. Staff was very professional and friendly. rooms were very clean with all you need. breakfast was excellent and quality and selection was great. wellness area was spacious and well managed. For our next trip in Berlin, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomekWu
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights - standard room with courtyard view. Great, very comfy beds. Breakfast very good, just standard quality for this kind of hotels. Staff OK. Pool quite big, unfortunately a lot of screaming children. Location is pretty good, but not in the middle of action - close to U-Bahn, bus stops and some good shops. Next time I'd probably stay somewhere else, closer to Berlin Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: anca2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good situated just across the street from the Zoo.The staff and services are excellent, I can't think of anything I didn't liked here.If you want a pleasant stay in Berlin this is the hotel for you. KA DE WE is 5 minutes away from the hotel. A truly excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel exceeded all of our expectations”
Reviews.Author: LauraJ66
Reviews.Content: We were a small grp of family and friends going on a short 3 day trip to Berlin - first trip to Germany. We thoroughly researched Berlin hotels and picked this one on the strength of the consistently good reviews on Trip Advisor. Very easy to get to from Tegel airport - X9 bus to Zoo and then either walk to Hotel bout 5 mins or get a no 200 bus which stops virtually outside the hotel on Buderpester Strasse. Reception v welcoming and we asked for and were given a view of the Zoo on the 6th floor (don't worry the lifts are quick and pleasant). This overlooks the quiet tree lined street that the hotel is located off but just by the main shopping areas and transport links - this is a bonus, as it is away from the really busy main streets where other big hotels are located. The view is incredible. Our room was immaculately clean, spacious and welcoming as were the corridors and seated viewing areas. Daily housekeeping with complimentary water, tea and coffee replenished, a bonus after a long day of sightseeing. Roger Gallet complimentary toiletries. The pool and spa areas are wonderful and as a guest you have free use of the facilities. We ensured we paid a bit extra to have the breakfast buffet included and I do recommend you to do that - the choice is huge and the quality is amazing - you just have to experience it to believe it. We were so full, we never needed to buy lunch and only felt like tea and cake mid afternoon. Ask for the adjoining room at the back of the dining area and you will feel you are in a private, exclusive salon. The decor is beautiful. What we also loved about this hotel is the staff - unfallingly polite, helpful and kind - they really do want to make your stay the best posible - absolutely nothing is too much trouble. The Concierge is amazing and you can do most things there like buying your transport tickets, making reservations or booking the Reichstag visit or a river trip. It makes it all so easy. Their recommendation for a nearby Italian was spot on - lovely food, service and atmosphere - the Via Condotti.. Overall, this hotel exceeded our expectations and we will be back as soon as possible - we aren't alone in our opinion, as we noticed that lots of different airline pilots were checking in as well and they usually know a thing or two. This hotel is clearly a corporate hotel but it is also a luxury hotel, which is family friendly. Do try it - I am sure you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Top facilities, services and staff”
Reviews.Author: opentrail
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel for a weekend city break. Treat yourself to the Spa, swim and have a workout before venturing out into Berlin. Staff very customer focused. Great breakfast and good value if you can get a deal... Half price. I will be looking for this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - but really noisy spa!”
Reviews.Author: AntoinetteKerrie
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, new, modern, clean, and friendly staff. Our room was a nice size, although they said they had upgraded us - but hotels often say that. We asked for a quiet room, away from the lift and we got what we asked for. Room service was excellent, very fresh and hot - we ordered Club Sandwich which with chips which was huge and delicious, plenty to share. A nespresso coffee machine with pods was in the room for free use, and the bottled water was also free - such a nice gesture. Breakfast was excellent and delicious with everything on offer. The only thing I didn't like was that they always wanted to seat us, fair enough, but we wanted to sit somewhere quiet. The first 2 mornings it wasn't a problem, and we were allowed to sit where we wished, but the 3rd morning the lady told us to sit in a noisy area - we moved and sat somewhere else and when the lady saw us we got a rude glare from her. Unfortunately, we booked this hotel for the Spa experience, and it was not an experience I would like to repeat. Whilst it was a lovely, new and modern Spa, it was incredibly noisy. We had to go and lay outside to relax. Not just children screaming throught he pool area, but the adults too. Absolutely no respect for peace and quiet. We thought is was a one off on the first night, but no, it was every night. I hoped the attendants would say something, but again, no. It was awful. As a hotel just for sightseeing, it's great, but if you would like a romantic weekend, a definite no - this is a really busy hotel and the Spa area was really noisy until it closed, so I definitely wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice & modern hotel. Would have been one of the best hotels I have ever stayed & this is even compared to USD$500+/night hotels. Nice breakfast, very friendly staff. Will be staying here on my next Berlin trip for sure.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in top location – with great swimming pool!”
Reviews.Author: PushingTheSenses
Reviews.Content: the hotel is centrally located, right next to the zoo and close to the frauenkirche, only a short walk from kurfuerstendamm. service and friendliness of the staff was outstanding. even though the hotel seemed to be packed over the weekend, they still managed to provide excellent service at breakfast. liked: nice, spacious rooms large swimming pool – that alone is worth staying at this hotel good breakfast choice friendly service excellent concierge service

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Radisson, Novotel, The Palace Hotel, Pullman Berlin is the best of the best. The pool/spa area is fantastic with probably the largest hotel pool in Berlin. We stayed in a deluxe room with a room size about 28 m2. The beds were very comfortable and there were two types of pillows for each. The rooms are sound proof. An nespresso machine was a nice feature in the room. Prices in the bar are a little high but the same as other 5 start hotels. We ate at the Xenia restaurant and it was very very good and there was excellent service. However, expensive. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great services, clean, great breakfast and great pool”
Reviews.Author: Shellyzak
Reviews.Content: We arrived early to the hotel and received keys to our room with no extra hassels. The room is clean and all the services are just great.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Cymroardaith
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in every way. Convenient, central location - five or ten minutes walk from the Zoo hub from where public transport to all major parts of the city is available. Many of the city's main sights and shopping areas are within easy walking distance. Well appointed, large, comfortable and quiet rooms - ours overlooked the garden. Not a blemish in sight. Professional, multilingual staff who understand customer satisfaction means! Very reasonable rates too - possibly because there are so many decent hotels in the locality.

Reviews.Title: “If only all hotels where like the Pullman!”
Reviews.Author: Andrexel
Reviews.Content: ust come back from a three day trip to Berlin and was very impressed at the quality of the Pullman. The hotel was refurbished to a high standard about three years ago and is very well run. Check in was efficient friendly and quick, Rooms are fair size with 32Inch TV's, mini bar and all the extras for a hotel of the category (Ask for a room on the side overlooking the tiergarden). Restaurant food was excellent and breakfast was a very good German style buffet breakfast but perhaps a little expensive. We spent quite a while in the bar (perhaps to long!) the cocktails are very well mixed and during happy hour (9pm hence the name of the bar!) all are 6 Euros each! Pool & sauna & Gym are very clean and efficient and even has a sun terrace for those hotter months. WiFi was chargeable but they do have a free 24hr internet room with 4 pcs and a printer so can not really complain as this is a hotel aimed mainly at the business traveller. However its in a great location being just moments from the gates of the Zoo in tiergarten. If flying into Tengel airport get the X9 airport bus (about 15 mins) and then get of zoo then its a 5 min walk or you can jump on the 200 bus which takes you to just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, private parking and more”
Reviews.Author: AnJou_11
Reviews.Content: We will definitely be back: swimming pool, excellent breakfast, good rooms, near the Zoo and railway station Zoo, everything neatly wrapped!

Reviews.Title: “nice breakfast and pool but ...”
Reviews.Author: Kimonzanoi
Reviews.Content: Nice breakfast buffé but too crowded around it. A little bit hysterical and stressful when crowded like this. Nice poolarea but there was a male in the ladies shower so it didn´t feel safe. 10 minutes walk from the underground, buses, sighseeing tours and main shopping street. 15 minutes walk from the bus to Airport Tegel. 2 minutes walk to an entrance to the Berliner Zoo. The room was ok but they didn´t recharge our shower creams the last day. There was an insect on the wall in our room. The beds were comfortable and the airconditioning was working well, so we slept very well. The area around the hotel felt safe. Is this a five stars hotel? I am not sure that the hotel is really worth it. It is more like a ****+

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: PeterNG
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of the other excellent Tripadvisor reviews and were very pleased. Rooms, reception and concierge service, breakfasts, and swimming pool were all as expected. Superb attention to detail in areas such as fresh flowers and presentation of the food. We generally use 4star hotels and at this grading they are faultless. I don't know what 5star regulars expect but, for example, if you want doormen hovering ready to grab your cases and car keys you will be disappointed. The location is good for public transport being on the 200 bus route and with the Zoological Garden rail station and bus terminus nearby. Allow 6-7 euros per person per day to get around by the superb public transport network (this includes getting to and travel within Potsdam, for example). Not so good for finding restaurants within walking distance .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has good features and is near train/bus”
Reviews.Author: PerthEngineer
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because we wanted a comfortable, quiet hotel near the tourist parts of Berlin. It was perfect for this! We don't speak German, however, all the staff spoke impeccable English (and probably many other languages as well.!!) The hotel has a business room with free-to-use computers and a printer. This was a great boon as we could check emails and make onwards bookings while staying within the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for 4 day visit”
Reviews.Author: ladygolfer19
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it has a large pool and quiet location on the 200 bus route from Zoo Station to all the main points of interest. Real bonuses were the quality food in the restaurant and the hotel concierge, who managed to get us into the Reichstag Dome, for which you now have to book.

Reviews.Title: “everything you would expect from a modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: elinasia
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Service was amazing, our room was great, food at breakfast and hotel restaurant was excellent. Swimming pool and spa area is good too, not very big but modern, clean and quite functional. It is walking distance to KAdewe but not so close to main touristic sites. However Berlin's transport is pretty good, had no problem reaching wherever I needed to go. Had a wonderful time there!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: Usenko Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in February 2011. Really nothing to complain about. Everything was excellent. The hotel is located on a side quiet street opposite Berlin Zoo, 10 minutes of walk to U-Bahn (metro) and Bus Terminal. The hotel was recently converted to Pullman from Sofitel. Great lobby, helpful staff on the reception, fabulous SPA area with hammam, sauna and large pool. We lived in the Deluxe Room. This room features free Wi-Fi as well as free mini-bar and Nespresso coffee machine with selection of coffee. 2 big bottles of water are complimentary. And free mini-bar doesn’t mean 2 Cokes and 2 bottle of water. Minibar is fully filled with beer, sparkling wine, juices and snacks refilled daily. Room is nicely decorated with modern but adequate style. There is separate sitting area with 2 chairs and large glass desk. Large bed is fantastic with lots of pillows. We didn’t try breakfast so I have nothing to say about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: udigold1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for seven nights with my wife on April 2011. What can I say? Room: Had lots of space, new furniture, the bed was super comfortable, best sleep ever! Reception: Very welcoming! Amenities: Pool, Spa, free coffee in the afternoon, 4 computers with internet and a printer. Breakfast: A plethora of food to choose from! But a bit expensive (24 euros per person). Transportation: Just outside the hotel you can take bus No. 200, and No.100 is a street away. U-Bahn is 5-10 minute walk (WittenbergPlatz or Zoologischer Garten) Price: 120 euros per night - that's a bargain for a hotel that's so good! Will definitely stay there in future visits to Berlin! Keep on the with the great work!
