Reviews.Title: “What a city view and 'wow' they have done a great improvement job”
Reviews.Author: stalenbu
Reviews.Content: I knew this Hotel from the 90"s and it had a different Corporate Owner. Found a good rate through my travel agent so tried it again. Now I must say, this Hotel has improved itself dramatically. Reception is large, open space and staff very friendly. Concierge knows his stuff. Rooms are sufficient, lovely beds, large tv, nice writing desk, effective lighting, bathroom a little small. The gym was perfect for me and the pool is very large for city Hotel Morover, Hotel is close to Zoo and Kurfurstendam but even Potsdammer Platz is not too far walking. There are various parks in front of the Hotel. WiFI is not free but seems very common in Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: FabFabFabFab
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, centrally located. Very nice beds, very clean, bathroom is a bit small but nice. Nice, state of the art TV station. Very nice view from the room. Bar and restaurant are very nice. Delicious breakfast. Gym is a bit small. Unfortunately no free internet. They have four PC stations from where you can access internet for free. Employees are very nice, super competent and friendly. No iPod docking station in the room. All in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four or five star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malibuite
Reviews.Content: The beds are wonderful, rooms clean, bathrooms are small and tub showers are not very safe for older people. This was one of their best rooms but certainly not even four star rating. Good overnight hotel if you are living out of your suitcase, but hanging closet is 15" width with eight hangers, not enough for a couple staying five nights. No drawer space, and three small shelves, really quite expensive at 255 Eur per night. When booking breakfast was included, when we arrived the next morning they said it was not! The advertising said complimentary breakfast? It was a pleasant stay but overpriced for what we received. Dr. CT

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with all amenities”
Reviews.Author: OsloKrisa
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Pullmann Berlin Schweizerhof. The room was so comfy we stayed in the first night ordering delicious room service food. (The menu is vast and varied) The staff at the hotel are very friendly and corteous, the food is good, excellent breakfast. The hotel also boasts a really relaxing SPA/Pool area with an outdoor sun deck. Everything is modern and inviting. The hotel´s located right in front of the Berlin Zoo, an excellent situation for shopping and a good base for exploring the whole of Berlin. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money ...”
Reviews.Author: r_stanzel
Reviews.Content: .. easy to find in Berlin by car, excellent location. Car parking could be a bit better organised. If you pay the carpark upfront for a few days, does not necessarily guarantee you a car spot. That was the only somewhat weird thing to notice. Ohter than that, never had anywhere else such a variety of breakfast buffet ever. Was just great. Rooms all new and quiet. Great place for business stay and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a very good central location at the Tiergarten, excellent Spa conditions with a large pool, opportunity for jogging in the Tiergarten park close to the hotel, friendly and competent service, for me the bar looks too 'clinical' and is also from its location not a MUST to visit

Reviews.Title: “BELIEVE ME IT'S FOR SURE NO.1 HOTEL IN BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: lipere
Reviews.Content: The room is so clean,big and has a great bathroom the breakfast is so great omlets alot of different cheese; capuccino order by the waitress;etc the wellness spa is so great-it has a big pool with gym with an open window to the pool;great sauna. finally the service by the staff is just fantstic, everything we ordered we got we will come back to this hotel for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade from Expedia...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a fabulous buffet breakfast (just get a table closer to the food to avoid a long walk). We had to upgrade from the basic Expedia offering, but for 20 euros per night, we got a Nespresso machine, free Internet, and free mini bar. The pool and spa are excellent. Sauna is mixed, so not for the prudish. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel poor staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ac11_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the pullman for a two night stay on arrival we were greated by a cocky and arrogant receptionist who gave the impression that young travellers were not welcome she demanded that we show the credit card we booked the hotel with even though this wasn`t stated on purchase,after a full hour of ringing home for the credit card and holder to be confirmed we were allowed to the room. The room was fabulous and really modern with great views of the citys skyscrapers and zoo,hotel is surrounded by lots of tourist shops and nice church plus there is a cool irish bar in the europa center which also has other amenities which was good. Breakfast buffet was nice with a varity of different foods to suit taste. To sum up the pullman is really cool but more of a business hotel and on checking out there wasn`t even a thank or goodbye even though we paid a lot of money to stay. I would recommend the pullman to people who have thick skin and aren`t easily offended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service from Concierge (Sandy) and Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: maeve59
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 3 night stay in this wonderful hotel and would definitely recomment it to others. We found the accommodation very clean and well equipped and were given a lovely room on the 8th floor with a view overlooking the zoo. The breakfast was an amazing buffet. It has a super swimming pool and a well equipped gym and wellness centre. The hotel is well located for sight-seeing and within walking distance of 2 underground stations (5/10 mins). We bought the welcome 3 day travel pass at the airport (E25) and this covered all our transport needs while in Berlin including getting to/from airport. The concierge arranged a private sight-seeing tour (2 1/2 hours) of Berlin by car - highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Simbaland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Superior Room, which was spacious in general but clothes storage was insufficient for 2 people. This would be my only complaint about my stay here. The staff have at all times been corteous and helpful (especially at the restaurant, where they made extra effort to make something special at breakfast as I am a vegetarian). The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Zoo and Aquarium, and a short bus/cab ride from other tourist hotspots like the Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag etc. There is also a great spa with a pool and a 24-hour gym

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel. Who needs the Hilton when you can have the Schweizerhof at half the price!”
Reviews.Author: graykaren
Reviews.Content: We used Expedia who came up with a varied selection of hotels. Not having visited Berlin before we were a bit worried what and where we were booking. Well all our fears were put to rest when we arrived. Having taken one train from the airport to the Zoo and then a 5 minute walk to the hotel. It is situated in West Berlin and near the famous shopping area. We purchased a £5 all day, any transport card which was fantastic value and the bus took us on a 5 minute journey to the main tourist area. We were pleased to be in a quieter area at night but a 5 minute walk took you to a fantastic Irish Bar with live music every night and every kind of restaurant you could want. The hotel rooms were spotless and very new with excellent plasma tv and the breakfast was amazing each morning. I never thought you could have a 5 course breakfast but we did. Anything from continental to full English breakfast. Make sure you get the free breakfast in with your deal as you will not need to look at food again until the evening. The other treat was the spa. Fantastic swimming pool, apparently the largest for a hotel in Berlin and a relaxing spa . There did not seem to be any problem with the children using it, all ages had fun. Great after a day of sightseeing. Overall, absolutely fantastic deal in a great 4 star hotel. We looked at the Hilton and Westin Gate which were both a couple of hundred pounds more and this Pullman hotel we feel was although very modern on par with the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sipaq
Reviews.Content: * Location The hotel is located in the western part of the city near the Kurfuerstendamm and directly opposite to the Intercontinental Berlin. We arrived there by public transport (S-train from Berlin main station to Berlin Zoo, then Bus 200 to Budapester Straße). From the bus stop it was only 50 meters to the hotel. The Kurfuerstendamm lies in walking distance. With the Bus 200 you can also head directly to various points of interest (e.g. Potsdamer Platz, Friedrichstraße, Alexanderplatz, etc.) * Arrival We were greeted warmly and were already pre-upgraded to a superior room. I requested an additional suite upgrade, which was denied, instead I received an upgrade to a deluxe room, which was few square meters larger than th superior room. It also had a Nespresso coffee machine and we got the minibar for free, which was great. * Room The room was nice, quiet and spacious. Everything was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The Nespresso machine was definitely an upside, as the coffee tastes great. * Bar We got a voucher for a free drink in the bar, which we used on the first evening. The bar is not exceptional in any way, but the staff was very nice and the pricing is definitely below the standard, that one expects from hotel bars in a capital city. We had a snack there (Currywurst - what else in Berlin), which was great and quite a deal. * Neigbourhood As said before, the Kurfuerstendamm and the KaDeWe are both in walking distance. We had a very good (and cheap) breakfast in a small bakery right around the corner on Kurfuerstenstrasse right next to an Europcar car rent station, which I can definitely recommend. * Spa From all the pictures that we saw, the Spa looks great, but we didn't have the time to visit it. We had a very pleasant stay and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean and excellent breakfast, including made to order omelets.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: MichaelofArabia
Reviews.Content: Speedy check in, great service from the front desk staff. But the problem are the tiny basic standard rooms. More of an Ibis standard with 5* prices. Service and facilities are great, but the room size/standard does not justify the $$$ you pay.

Reviews.Title: “In a word "Excellent"!”
Reviews.Author: tsofli
Reviews.Content: New hotel in a very convenient location, very close to the bus stop (bus no 200) which takes you through Berlin, right opposite the Zoo. The breakfast buffet in the morning was just perfect, with a wide variety of cerials, eggs, sausages, fruits etc. The staff was very polite and helpful and spoke English. The room was spacious and very clean and looked brand new. The beds were extremely comfortable, it was like I had never left my bed. I bet everyone has had one of those experiences when you wake up and can't move, so it was a nice surprise to find not only it look comfortable but it was!!! There isn't free internet access in the room but on the second floor there's a connection room with four computers and a printer to print off anything you might want, like a map or something like that. I definitely recommend this hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with pricey breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lunow
Reviews.Content: Staying in Pullman Schweizerhof was a quite pleasant experience. If you like modern hotels with stylish minimalistic interior, you will enjoy staying in Schweizerhof. I have stayed there for a single night, so I didn't have a chance of experiencing much more than my room and the breakfast restaurant. My Classic Room on 7th floor, average size, was overlooking Berlin ZOO. I imagine the view at any time of year other than winter is stunning - no tigers or lions spotted this time. The cleaning standard is average, with several hairs spotted in the bathroom upon arrival, the rest of the room was although acceptable. I have little to complain about, when it comes to the amenities. An ironing board would have been great, and not having such in what I would categorize as a business hotel surprises me a bit. What annoyed me was the strangely functioning air conditioning. It isn't possible to set a desired temperature as one would normally do. You can only adjust a preset temperature with 3 steps up and down. This wasn't quite enough for me, as I prefer sleeping in a chilled room. Thankfully the window could be opened, allowing cold and fresh air do the job. Additionally, do yourself a favour and save the 24€ which is the cost of the breakfast. You can easily grab something in a café for a fraction of the price, as eating out in Berlin is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ericliv Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location. Nice pool and spa. Be careful of sauna, as key for locker burnt my hand as sauna was so hot. It also melted the coating on the lenses of my glasses!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend it - especially if you stay in quiet spa-side of property”
Reviews.Author: jcbexleyoh
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in December and found the hotel met all our needs quite nicely. Because the weather is cold and often snowy, we wanted a hotel with a pool to warm us. This property has a wonderful large, elegant pool and provides comfortable lounges, robes, slippers and towels. There is also an fitness room overlooking the pool. Our room was near the pool on a part of the hotel which is extremely quiet. Our room was elegantly spare, really comfortable with great beds and club chairs with ottomans. My only complaint is the sheets were stiff and starchy, harsh really on the skin. I plan to let the hotel know of that. We had very good service from the check-in staff, and okay conceirge help. Some were better than others. This hotel does a lot of convention and event business so it does make an independent traveler feel a little lost in the lobby - but we would recommend it for its other assets: great location on main bus line, very close to the Zoo train station, the Kurfustendam shopping area, etc. We did not eat at the property - the restaurant menu was rather odd - and breakfast is expensive for people who just want coffee, cocoa and bread. Around the corner is a French cafe which has excellent breakfasts at much less cost. If you like to swim, want a comfy retreat from the city, and do not mind a large business hotel setting, you will probably enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: cmm218
Reviews.Content: The Pullman was a nice place to stay in West Berlin. You are located very near to the Zoo, KaDeWe (the famous department store), many nice shopping areas and centers of public transportation. The breakfast buffet was amazing. Cons: WiFi costs 9 euros per 24 hours!! The business center has 4 computers that you can use for free but we had to wait to get on them every time. The room is nice but the pillows on the bed were very flat. Overall a good place to stay, even for an extended visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Kurfürsten Strasse and Zoo”
Reviews.Author: DahlFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two children (2 and 4 years) old in one of the suites. The size of the suite is two standard room plus some more. The suite is divided into two where you can put the kids in one end so they can sleep tight without being disturbed. There is even a sliding door. The rooms are completely sound proof so it can be even hard to hear when somebody is knocking on the door. The hotel is just great - very modern - the pool is very big (maybe the largest in Berlin hotels) which is nice so you can play with the kids without disturbing the other guest. There is a sauna, hot stone seating etc. Being a Accor Platinum member I must say that this hotel has a really high service level. The receptionist really went the "extra mile" for us. Which was greatly appreciated. Thank you, Nina. We had absolutely nothing to complain about. However, I still believe that Wifi should be free in a suite but it still isn't - but then again you can surf for free in the business center on the 2nd floor. Parking is 20 euros pr. day. Room service is the same price as in the restaurant just with 3,5 euro in extra charge - this is fair enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: 1dannymac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend trip at the hotel. We were meeting some friends from Germany there, and they had hotel points to use. I would have preferred a room closer to the center of the city, or on the east side. It was a very nice and modern hotel. The breakfast was a bit expensive, so we used some of the nearby restaurants each morning for breakfast. The bar prices were fair though. We were a couple of minutes walk from the S-Bahn line, which made getting into the center and east side pretty easily. Overall, I would recommend it as a place to stay, if you don't mind being a bit outside of the action.

Reviews.Title: “PULLMAN BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! Location, service and comfort unbeatable

Reviews.Title: “Very well run hotel with excellent indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: Sub_three
Reviews.Content: Bright modern business hotel near to the zoo and the Tiergarten – we had a mid-week four night stay – most other residents were business and conference types – only a few other pleasure seekers who, like us, were spending their own money and not on expense accounts. Very difficult to find any fault at all – very efficiently run hotel with polished highly courteous staff. We liked: - quick and efficient check in (arrived a little early - room ready and waiting) - bright and airy room (comfortable and quiet) - tea making facility in the room - well equipped bathroom with robes and slippers - comfortable bed - excellent large indoor pool (gym, sauna and steam rooms available also) - drinks in the bar - location (a few minutes walk from the main bus station and S-Bahn and the biggest Irish bar in Berlin) We disliked: - cost of breakfast buffet (opted to use local cafes instead) Overall a good hassle free place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shosh1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Berlin in May 2010. Beautiful hotel, well decorated, clean, friendly staff, delicious full breakfast, next to a beautiful park and a large shopping zone, convenient public transportation anywhere you need to go. beautiful pool and fitness room. We were a group of four and all of us loved the hotel. Warmly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bexie123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Good location for restaurants, bars and transport. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Nastia82
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. The rooms were very good and the location very convenient. The reception staff could be more helpful though!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel for Visiting the city while Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: gloriajones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary and we were very happy with the excellent customer service and facilities available at this hotel. We booked a few months ahead and got a very good deal. On check in they also offered us a 15 Euros coupon to use for drinks/food at their restaurant. Breakfast starts at 6.30 and lasts until midday (perfect for us as we like to take things easy during the weekend) and it is delicious, the variety of bread they offer is amazing! The pool and Spa are also great and we spent there a relaxing Sunday afternoon (they left us use the facilities even after check out). We didn't eat at the restaurant but had a couple of drinks there, nice atmosphere and great mojitos. The location is pretty convenient, just 10 min walk from the train station (zoological garten stop), also bike rental shops are nearby. Riding a bike in Berlin is in our opinion the best visit the city (weather permitting of course) and also very cheap. Pity the don't offer free wi-fi. We'll definitely be back for another weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackswan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, at excellent value. We got a special offer, paying €60 each per night for a superior room on the top (9th) floor at the front of the hotel with a fantastic view out over the Tiergarten. This however excluded breakfast, since we thought it was a bit pricey at €24 extra each. There are plenty of cafes nearby that do great breakfasts! The room was very comfortable, as were the beds. They were also very quiet...even though at the front on the main road, no traffic could be heard. They were spotless too, as was the bathroom. Our superior room included robes and slippers which were great for using to go down to the pool in! The only fault i'd have with the room was that the a/c wasn't very effective. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We are a same-sex couple and they made us feel very welcome at check-in. Pool staff were also extremely friendly! Pool facilities are exceptional, with a feeling of luxury and high quality. There's a really great sauna/steamroom area with foot baths, a tropical shower and ice basin! Around the pool are comfortable loungers, a sun deck, and a drink and snack service. There is also a small gym, but we didn't use this! The only let down with this hotel was the lack of free wifi. To use the wifi there was a very high charge per day. This seems to be common around berlin however...we only found free wifi in the starbucks cafes...unfortunately! Location is good...10min walk to nearest U-bahn and S-bahn stations.

Reviews.Title: “BEST MATTRESSES I HAVE EVER SLEPT ON!!”
Reviews.Author: thomais
Reviews.Content: Apart from their anatomic and relaxing beds, I have to commend on the clean and comfortable shauna facilities, as well as on their luxurious breakfast, and on their clean room. The staff was so proffesional and polite,but too Germanish for us coming from south Europe!! Keep on the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: WelcomeTur
Reviews.Content: I´ve booked This Hotel from booking.com, it was a prepaid stay, so I was a little worried. The Hotel is perfect, the location, the rooms, the staff everything works just fine. Our room was very nice, very good interior design, good bathroom and amenities from Roger & Gallet. The breakfast was a little noisy but works perfectly. In adition to all this good points there´s a very well appointed spa and wellness center. The sauna is great, the swimming pool is huge, doesn´t look like a Hotel pool at all. The Gym with equipments from TechnoGym has a great view to the pool...is a perfect spot to work out!! I´d definitively recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “service was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: cardiffafterdark
Reviews.Content: Having had my luggage delayed, the reception staff were most helpful in organising teeth cleaning & shaving kit. When the luggage eventually turned up it was brought up to the room with the minimum of fuss. The hotel has a pleasant atmosphere especially with regard to the front of house staff who couldn't have been more helpful if they tried. The rest of the staff were courteous and professional as well. The bedroom was adequate,the pool superb,gym nothing special,restaurant overpriced,bar pleasant & quite lively. Overall the hotel definitely added to the quality of my stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A marvelous Hotel in the Center of the City”
Reviews.Author: Fruehlingsgold13
Reviews.Content: Everything is just great. The Staff, the Hotelroom, the Pool, the nice view over the Zoo and just minutes to walk to the biggest shopping streets. The Hotel Pool is the biggest in Berlin Hotels. Choice of Saunas included. Relaxing Area with Newspapers and freshly made Juices. Recptionniste always at your Service!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with great facilities and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ErikHof
Reviews.Content: Pullman hotel is a really nice modern hotel with modern spacious rooms. The breakfast of the hotel is really great and the gym and spa/wellness facilities are perfect. The only thing is that the location of the hotel is not great and that the food and drinks in the hotel bar and restaurant are very expensive and the internet as well.

Reviews.Title: “okay i guess”
Reviews.Author: fathead77
Reviews.Content: berlin is amazing and the pullman is in a good spot close to the shopping of kurfersterdam and easily accessible to everywhere. the hotel jogged up the prices for the week as there was a convention in town (about 30% higher). rooms were nice, but the bed was terribly uncomfortable, the food/drink expensive and the internet was ridiculously expensive. it did have nice amenities (roger gallet) and the housekeeping staff was fantastic (even if they couldn't speak any english). however, after checking out, i realized i had left some expensive face soap in the room. and when i asked the front desk if anything was left, they said no. which was completely untrue. definitely colored my perception of the hotel. i'd recommend the hotel, but with big trepidations.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay at Pullman Schweizerhof...love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SkunkFunk29
Reviews.Content: For the last 14 years I've visited Berlin at least once a year...it's one of my favourite city's! Especially the nightlife in Berlin is awesome,but enough other cool things to see and do in this vibrant city! Since 2 years I always stay at the Pullman Schweizerhof which is a former Sofitel hotel. Last week it was my 3rd stay at this hotel and it was great again! The rooms are spacious,stylish with a huge flatscreen TV and the beds are really comfortable!!! Friendly and professional staff at the reception and in the bar. But the big plus of this hotel is their wellness centre...huge swimming pool and very nice hamam,sauna and gym! The whole wellness centre has been renovated last year and is also really stylish!! Never used their restaurant or breakfast so can't say a word about it; except that it is expensive! Only negative thing I can mention is that it's really warm in the hallways! But this hotel is the ideal base to visit Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: jacobo88
Reviews.Content: Since you come in you are received with a smile and the attencion you desserved, thats whats make the difference between hotels and first class hotels. What can i say... excellent. Fantastic view to the zoo and just some blocks from the main street kudamm.Great room. Definitely a place to stay next time I stop shoppingin Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pet Friendly Hotel ; Location, Cleanliness, and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: puffpromotions
Reviews.Content: We found The Pullman to be off the beaten path, but close enough to walk for shopping, meals, and the zoo. I would highly recommend this hotel, plus, we brought our dog, and we had zero problems. Very pet friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zephyrus33
Reviews.Content: Modern, comforable hotel with good location close to old centre of West Berlin. Good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb...”
Reviews.Author: MadsCopenhagenDK
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at this Berlin hotel for the first time - and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Started out good by getting an upgrade when mentionning it was my first visit there. So I was installed on the 9th floor overlooking the Zoo. The entire hotel is either very new or recently refurbished - and it looks great everywhere. The location is also fantastic - only a short 4 min. walk to Kurfürsten Damm and 5 min. to KaDeWe. Couldn't get any better for any sort of visit... I had room service as I don't really want to bother going to a restaurant as a solo traveller - the food was excellent. Well prepared, reasonably priced and served warm - all in all - perfect. Only 2 minor things - 1) The drain in the bath room sink was shut (not blocked - just closed) - and I could not in any way get it out. I found out just on my way to bed and did not bother calling for someone to come repair it at 11 p.m. - but was anoying in the morning. I am sure that if I had called they would have sent someone immediately. The bath room didn't really live up to the rest of the hotel or room... should have been done more exclusively. 2) WLAN is incredibly expensive - I had to pay €25 for a 24 hour acces - and not that great bandwithd. Radisson hotels provides WLAN for free - something every business hotel should do. Paying that much money is robbery... Breakfast buffet was plentyful and good. Cooks are standing by to cook fresh omelets or different variations of scrambled eggs at your desire. Other than that there is everything you would want on a breakfast buffet. I give this hotel my strongest recommendation for any sort of travel - be it romance (plenty of possibilities of pampering - spa, massages, etc.), business or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hi-Tech Pullman”
Reviews.Author: DavidMooney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location, just behind the Irish Bar in central Berlin. Room and bathroom good size and very modern,good breakfast and excellent value for money.Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: JG-JG8
Reviews.Content: The Pullman is a good hotel for business visits. The staff is very accomodating of one's needs. When I arived late at night, I was welcome by the porter who was smiling and full of energy and ready to help. The receptions staff were the same despite the very late hour. The breakfast excellent andd we had a meeting at the hotel that was well organised in a very nice and fres meeting room. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “excelent Cost/benefice”
Reviews.Author: mfgn
Reviews.Content: Stay there 3 nights after a cuise in the baltic sea. Luxury Hotel with excelent cost. The SPA facilities are very beautiful. The staff is very profissional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Livi_Looby
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband spent 3 nights at this hotel, having got a very reasonable deal on a deluxe room. (approx 300 Euros for the entire stay) The hotel is lovely and clean. I was a little apprehensive before going to this hotel as I am a light sleeper and often find city hotels noisy. However, I am pleased to say this was not a problem. (However we were situated on the 9th floor at the back so am unable to say if this is the same throughout the hotel). Rooms were very modern, white with a huge plasma TV, however there were only 2 English chanels (and by the end was a bit MTV and news'd out) - still not there to watch TV. The spa facilities were lovely, although a little confusing. When you first enter the sauna area it appears that it is women only (as the entrance to the sauna is through the ladies changing room). However, I can confirm it is unisex as men also get to the same sauna by going through there changing room. I don' think it was just me as one guy, wondered in completely starkers!!!! Can't comment on the food as we were room only. All I would say is that it was a little expensive 17-22 Euros per person and we had no problems and saved ourselves a fortune eating out. Service was good and staff all appeared polite and friendly We also found the location great, it is situated a short walk from the Zoo (which we could recommend) and the aquarium and its within walking distance of the railway station (Zoologischer Garten). There are also many restaurants and bars within the vicinity. We certainly were able to do lots of sightseeing and found the public transport fantastic. All in an all a great comfortable, convenient stay.

Reviews.Title: “The great hotel that you expect!”
Reviews.Author: NdeA
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel. Everything new. Nice and comfortable room. Excellent breakfast, full of delicious and assorted food. Very professional staff. Spectacular swimming pool and spa. The hotel provides you everything for the bathroom (soap, shampoo...) and bathrobes and slippers for the spa. You can also use the computers they have for free during 1 hour. Ideal for your flight check in. The only point I can have some doubts is the location. Berlin is huge and the hotel is located in the West side. However, there are very good connections 5 min walking from the hotel. I'll repeat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gazza24
Reviews.Content: Couldn't really fault the Pullman Berlin and had a great stay. Very friendly reception staff made the check in nice and quick and we were given a lovely room on the 5th floor overlooking the zoo. Room was modern and spotless, although one thing i would say was the air-con was well needed as did get very hot in the room. Had a drink in the bar every evening and it did get quite busy, but the efficient bar staff were always on hand to keep us stocked with drinks... although a tad expensive... on the current exchange rate a glass of wine was costing nearly £8!! Check out again was speedy and friendly and there was a no-problem approach to any query we had. Would def stay here again should i return to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value !”
Reviews.Author: ElisabetNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three nights stay at the Pullman Berlin. Excellent standard, light and airy rooms. Pullman beds are among the best I ever slept in ! White, crisp and clean, just what one needs after a long day in the city. The breakfast is very good, lots of fresh produce and attentive staff ! Great location, just a stone's throw from Kurfürstendamm with the great KaDeWe! A tip: forget elegant shoes, instead take your walkingshoes ! The distances are huge ! Defenitly recommended if you like cool elegance and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Great Leisure Facilities on a Great Bus Route”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Wilburys3
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my fellow travelling friends in the Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof on a Leisure and culture break of Berlin for 3 nites. The hotel did not seem busy and the staff were attentive, well presented and pleasant with very good English. The location of the hotel is situated excellently considering the size of the city where everything is not together – IE – the city is very large with no real centre and thus spread out; So one needs to be on a bus route! This hotel is on a great bus route if not the best bus line and the 200 route goes outside the hotel and basically links west Berlin where the hotel is situated to east Berlin (old town). In fact the no. 200 bus goes the same way as the tour bus (in part). They also go every 10 mins and cost 2.50euro EW. They are safe and clean. The concierge in the hotel can organise tickets which you have to validate on the bus (although we did not realise this and effectively used it again the second nite). The location is opposite the Berlin Zoo and the beginning of the shopping area - Kurfürstendamm . There is a great department store – “KaDeWe” where they serve excellent food in various small boutique restaurants on the top floor whilst providing all the usual top international designers brands on the other 6 floor and refined palates will find it hard to choose from the some 33,000 delicacies from all corners of the world. Other good locations for Lunch would be the inspiring Italian Chain (german owned) called Vapiano which are located off the Ku-damn or around the corner from the Ritz Carlton which is located in the area between this hotel and the old town (east berlin) in an area know as Potsdamer Platz. However, back to the Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof which is the subject of this review. Now, the best thing about this hotel is the Leisure Centre with Spa facilities including showers and thermal treatments all of which are free. There is a full menu of massage and treatments which appear very reasonably priced. The pool is effectively the highlight of the hotel as its a great size with a luxury setting transposed with mood lighting and relaxing seating circumventing the pool. Assistance around the pool again like the lobby is excellent and professional which is courtesy of Mr. Butlins who was our leisure assistant for most of the evenings that we visited him. There is a discreet lift down to the pool area from the room which is excellent as it allows for one to use the complimentary robe and slippers from the room. The rooms themselves are well equipped (flat screen TV with in house movies and satellite channels), Internet access and minibar safe) and laid out. The only fault (if sharing) they are a little on the small side but the corridor area will always make up for this. The air conditioning is a little poor but might have been to do with the fact that we couldn't work it or two large lads in one rooms. There is a small little bar in the lobby that is smart and good place to end the nite after being to the Matrix or one of the other great nite spots in Berlin. There is a restaurant in the hotel which looks good but I cant comment on it, as we did not eat there - nothing to do with the hotel but merely because it better to go out and about. We went to the old town (Alexander Platz / TV tower area or overall the Mite area) in an area called the Nikolai quarter . This is the very core of old Berlin or, strictly speaking, of the eastern half of Cölln-Berlin, on the site of the oldest known settlement on a ford around the Nikolaikirche (St. Nicholas' Church). The Nikolaiviertel as its locally known as presents a stark contrast to the open spaces on its northern side between the Palace of the Republic and the Television Tower and contains great little restaurants, coffee shops and bars. However, its not the “temple bar” area in Dublin but starkly different with an emphasis more on romantics’ given its location along the River Spree. There is a fantastic French restaurant facing the river spree between a bar called Brauhaus Georgebrou and the next bridge up toward Ephraims coffee shop(about 50m) I would recommend the French onion soup and fantastic meat dishes with great collection of good French reds. So to sum up, a great city with some great sights with no better base to explore from than the Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof. Enjoy or as they say in Berlin - Hab Spaß! (JD)

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel with relaxing wellness area”
Reviews.Author: reddobie
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I would have given this hotel 5 stars, however, the fees for phone calls were outrageous...very difficult if you are an american, needing to call home to US..that said...let me move on to the review: The hotel is in a good location...not a far walk at all to the subway zoo station, or the Kudam station...Berlin is a cool city, very clean...the hotel is close to a money exchange store, at the "Euro Center" which is a very large indoor "mall" area...close to some nice restaurants, especially Italian restaurants, some neat little bars..overall we thought the prices in the area were good, especially for wines...most everyone spoke english...there are several nice stores, and you are maybe two streets fromt the Kudam, which is a street with restaurants and stores... The Hotel: not on a overally busy street. Very modern look to it...nicely decorated...impressive actually, front desk staff very nice...the rooms are a bit smallish, but not bad...very clean and modern looking...flat screen TV that you can program for english...it has a speaker in the bathroom as well...our room had no bureau!, but my brother's room did...he was a single, and we were two people with a lot of clothes, and one small closet for them, and a couple of shelf areas...I loved the tea/coffee drawer...HINT: you must pull the drawer all the way out, for the teapot to turn on...electric kettle...was a nice touch...there is a mini bar, but it was way over-priced...we simply removed some items, but put our own wine, milk and snacks in it, and no one ever said anything to us...the bathroom was roomy, however the blowdryer was terrible, bring your own/with adapter...There was a charge for internet use, seemed high, so we didn't use it, but the room had a desk that was equipped for it. The shower was great, always hot water, weird shower door, but it worked. They give you slippers/bathrobe, which we discovered is what they want you to use in the wellness area...we used the bathrobe, and our flip flops... Maid Service: outstanding...we tipped the maid third day we were there, as she did a great job..I left her messages in German for extra sugar, tea bags, and was always accomodated...the linens were very crisp and clean...the beds were fine...the pillows are okay, kind of mushy...I must mention the light situation, as no one at desk mentioned how to keep lights on, I just knew from reading it on trip advisor's forum from Mexico...you must keep one of your room keys in the slot by the door at all times while in the room to keep the lights on...very quiet room...never heard a peep in hallway etc...as others have mentioned, the rooms get too warm...and we were there end of Feb/beginning of March...we needed the A/C on, and the thermostat in the room only went just so far..we needed to keep window opened but it was kind of damp and nasty weather a few nights, so that wasn't good...we told front desk and they said they would adjust it, didn't seem to make too much difference, so when we left, we would leave both windows open to let some air in...also the beds don't have sheets..there is a bottom sheet but no sheet to cover you, you are supposed to use the feather bed to cover you, but it was so stuffy in room that this was way too hot, so we would remove the feather bed from the cover, and use the cover as a sheet...these were just some things we had to get used to, I haven't been to europe in a long time, and I guess I'm "americanized" so it was an adjustment...but I really liked the room, and just loved the tea kettle set up...overall impression of room/hallways/hotel is really nice pretty modern looking hotel...great little bar area...the happy hour is from 9PM to 10PM, and you can get some good prices on cosmos there, which were very good...we did not eat at the hotel, it seemed pretty pricey...breakfast was inclulded with our rate, and it was the best breakfast I've ever been to in any hotel...they had everything you could think of...including a station that made crepes, omelettes etc...a nice juice set up...and the rolls were to die for...best rolls I've ever had...if you can get that included in your rate, what a bargain, as its pretty expensive to pay for separate... The subway: very user friendly system, color coded, maps are avail at the little stores inside the stations, they have the ones with the larger print...easy to read, easy to use, no problems, and pretty clean...we purchased a pass for the week, and it included unlimited subway, train, bus use...which worked for us, as my brother's apt was outside Berlin city... Wellness Centre: Very nicely done..beautiful indoor pool, supposedly 82 F, but I will tell you when you first dip in, it seems kind of cold...you adjust pretty quickly, but I would like to have seen it much warmer..there is no hot tub so that could be disappointing for some...there is a great steam room, best I've ever used..it has a eucylptus infusion in it, which when first entered it is overpowering, but give it a chance, it was fantastic..my brother/sister had colds, and they said it was great for clearing their system...there are two rain showers then to wash off in, which were nice and toasty...we saw the ice, wasn't interested in it...and the foot spas, we didn't use those either...now if you go directly into pool after steam room, you will freeze going into that pool water...you will get used to it, but I really think they should up the temperature...we asked, and were told they couldn't...but nonetheless, the pool is pretty, and once you adjust to the temp, its quite nice to float, or swim in...the loungers at the pool were the most comfortable loungers ever, we fell asleep on them...its a very relaxing area...there is a cool upstairs area as well where you can read...and access an outdoor deck that was pretty, no chairs, but it was winter...The wellness area is so pretty and relaxing that the pool water really didn't matter too much in the end, as we used it everyday and enjoyed every bit of it... The lobby has a bowl of granny smith apples that you can take...so our overall impression of the hotel was I would stay there again, now that I am aware of the phone thing...which was really a headache for the first few days...our cells did not work, and the only way to reasonably call the US for us, was to walk to a "phone store" and use the phones in there, that was cheap...we bought a phone card, and at the end of our stay the hotel charged us 3.50 euro each time we used it from the room...I wish the hotel had told us that beforehand, as I asked them about the phone store to begin with.. that was a shocker to the tune of roughly 350.00 US dollars tacked onto our bill...we are trying to talk to hotel about that now, if they credit us some of that back then my rating would go up to 5 stars...I think that is way overpriced to charge tourists...Overall great modern pretty hotel, great area...fantastic wellness area....great stay...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AHotelier
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pullman Berlin for business. I chose the hotel as I had heard good things about it and knew someone who recommended it to me. I have to admit that the hotel was very good in all aspects, thus this review will be short & sweet. The hotel location is very good; close to the Zoo, train & bus stations & also to the Europa Centre & the Ku'Dam. The room was good, facing the courtyard, spacious, clean & well laid out. The only drawbacks were that the "Kingsize" bed was two single pushed together so not very comfortable. The towels in the bathroom were tiny..... Seriously! Breakfast is very good & well worth the €24, only if you have time to enjoy it to the full though! The spa was 1st class with a great variety of treatments, it's unfortunate that I did not have time to experience any. Staffwise they were all very friendly and apart from quite a long wait for the requested Iron & board (none in the room) & the small towels, I have no complaints. Berlin is a great city & I will be visiting again & yes, I will stay @ the Pullman!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Proposition”
Reviews.Author: aygen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pullmann for one night in February. I travel to Berlin frequently and stayed at several different 4/ 5 star hotels. Due to my experience Pullmann is the best value for the price. I booked a deluxe room. The room is very stylish, modern and good size. The Spa is newly renovated and the facilities are great. It has the biggest closed hotel swimming pool in Berlin. Very central location. The service is out-standing. I believe I found my hotel in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Berlin with large spa and pool area”
Reviews.Author: DahlFamily
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Schweizerhof several times it just keeps getting better. The new spa and pool area with massage is a must-try. An hours massage is about 65 euros. Do try the XENIA restaurant - it is very very good (a little expensive but worth it)! Also the food in the bar is good! We have absolutly no complaints - everything is perfect - well maybe the Internet charge is too expensive. We will definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Nothing real special though.”
Reviews.Author: tequilatamm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Berlin Schweizerhof in September... in fact, we check out tomorrow! We are in room 706 which is a room facing the courtyard. We gathered from reviews of the hotel that the courtyard view was prettier and more quiet. It's not particularly pretty, as it faces on to another office building with a few trees in between, but it is perhaps more quiet than facing the street side. My first impression of the Schweizerhof is that it didn't look as nice in person as it did in the photos... it looks much more like one of Accor's lesser chains, such as a Novotel, however the feel is a bit more elegant. There were several conferences going on over the weekend that we have been here, and at nearly all times of day, the lobby was crowded with people and receptions. I gather from the number of breakfasts and lunches, etc., that were setup in the lobby itself, they don't have much space in other areas to accommodate such things. This was a little bit annoying, as you had to weave through the crowds to get to and from the elevator when going/coming. However, it also gave the hotel a festive feel, so maybe in some ways it was good. One of our big complaints was with the climate control in the room. The room would get really stuffy in the early morning and stay that way until we returned in the evening, when the winter weather had cooled things off. When we enquired, we were told that, "Oh, you don't need air conditioning in the winter, so we've turned it off." However, the windows only open a slight bit, not enough to cool off the room, so after some insistence by us, reception contacted maintenance who supposedly came up to the room while we were out for the day and turned the air conditioning back on in our room. This seemed to work as the room felt cooler when we got back for the day, but once again, around 4 or 5am, it got really stuffy. For the third night of our stay, we asked to sign the obligatory waiver that we would not hold the hotel responsible if we jumped out the windows, were they to unlock them for us. They promptly, after that, sent someone up with a key to unlock the windows so we could open them all the way. The temperature is much cooler this evening, and will definitely make for nicer sleeping. I am now very happy we have the courtyard side, as sleeping with windows open on the street side would indeed be noisy! So anyway, climate control was a problem, however, the hotel was rather prompt at dealing with all our requests. The pillows were also a disappointment... nearly... nonexistent feeling. Our heads sink in to them and disappear into the matress. Tonight, we have requested a third pillow each, which was promptly delivered, and this will hopefully help the situation. A small complaint, but better pillows that aren't so hollow feeling would be nice too. Now for some of the good things. The hotel has what looks like a whole new "wellness" area, accessed from an internal lift well, so that you don't have to take the general elevator to get to it. The pool is large and although not as warm as we would have liked it to be, warm enough to swim in or take a dip after a long day out shopping and sightseeing. The pool is open until 10pm, which gives one time to go to it after a day out, which is also nice. It is manned by one staff in the evenings who always greets you nicely and offers towels, lockers, anything else you might want. There were nice lounges, and a bar that looked to serve fruit drinks and coffee/espresso, although not that time of the evening. There was an upstairs area called a "relax" area, which appeared to have a sundeck off of it, although we also didn't use this. The gym looked very nice, with all the normal equipment, but very modern. A few of each type of machine. Had we not walked so much I would have gladly made use of this. There are mens and womens locker rooms, and off of these, there is another common area which contains some pretty neat stuff. There was no jacuzzi, but there were both a wet steam room and a sauna. I love wet heat, and the steam room was one of the best I've ever been in... nice configuration, and lots of steam, with water hoses to make more steam when needed. In addition, in this area, there were two shower wells. One had no less than 7 shower outlets... some coming at all levels off the wall, plus an overhead rose. Next to it was an overhead "rainforest" shower, with glowing lights. Very nice. In addition to all this, there was an icemaker area in the wall which generated "snow" style ice, so you could cool yourself down after heating yourself up by using the "snow". But perhaps best of all was the "foot bath" area. A heated, tiled seat area, which had two foot basins at it. Put the funny looking plug in, fill up with water and let run. When the water gets to the top of the plug, it keeps draining at that level, so you can have a continuous flow of hot water on your feet, to soak in. FANTASTIC after walking around Berlin all day! I smuggled my camera in and took photos, so see the traveler photos attached for pictures of all this. Another thing I really liked about the room was the heated towel rail in the bathroom. We needed to do some hand wash, and this rail served a great purpose in drying our clothes very quickly! The shower head on the other hand didn't have the strongest stream of water ever and I had to take long showers to get all the soap out! We had breakfast included in our rate, and were pleasantly surprised at the freshness and tastiness of it. All of the "European" style breakfast items were quite fresh and nice tasting: Cold cuts, bread, cream cheese, cheese, etc. There were also hot dishes such as scrambled eggs, potatoes, a few kinds of sausages, etc. There was also a rather large selection of yoghurts and fruits which, if this is your thing, would have given you great choice of flavours! There was a cook who was ready to make you omelettes or crepes as you liked, and there were also thin waffles that had been previously made laid out for the taking. In addition, lots of breads and juices. All in all, not the most astounding breakfast I'd ever had at a hotel, but certainly right up there with the good ones. As far as location of the hotel, Berlin is a strange city, very spread out. The hotel is next to the zoo, about a 10 minute walk from Zoo Station where you can take the U & S trains, and not too much further to Kurfurstendamm, one of the big shopping areas. If these are what you want to be near, then the location is good, although there are similar hotels even nearer. If I had it to do over again, I might consider something like the Radisson, which is near museum island, but that's just me. I certainly wouldn't rule out this hotel, as it was a nice, solid stay, had friendly staff and all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sandysviews
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sofitel for two days on a jolly to Berlin. One thing we discovered very quickly that in Berlin the hotel you choose is all about location, there are some places which may have great reviews for the hotel but the location could be right oppposite a building site or miles from the nearest bars and restaurants, or just in the wrong part of town. Berlin has an awful lot of construction going on so choose carefully. This place is in a pretty excellent location really, right opposite the Zoo, specify a courtyard facing room if you want quiet, there is quite a busy road going past the front of the hotel, Across the busy road is the Zoo, you really want a room at the back of the hotel rather than at the front. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the famous bombed out church and the start of the K'dam, also 5 minutes walk is Ka De We which is the 2nd the biggest department store in Europe after Harrods. East Berlin centre is about 15 mins by taxi (there is a rank at the front of the hotel) The hotel itself is comfortable and well equipped with a very good range of spa treatments, the room we had was quite large and the only complaint we have is that the bath towels are very small, The goodies in the bathroom are very high quaility. The bar is quite small but serves everything you need at usual hotel prices. We didnt try the restaurant as we prefer to eat out but it seemed quite nice and very popular. The staff are efficient and very polite and helpful. All in all a perfectly good nice hotel in a very good location which as I said before is everything in Berlin. Top tip: if you fly in and out of Tegel airport dont go through the security and departures gates until you are ready to fly as there is Nothing on the other side of security, just gates and seats. small duty free in a cabin, I would definately stay at the sofitel again rather than risk a hotel in the wrong place which would seriously dent your enjoyment of a short stay

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: treeman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in Berlin on a business trip with my children. It was recommended by a business contact. It is a wonderful, modern hotel. The pool was closed for repair, but we did not miss it. The buffet breakfast was included in our rate and was fabulous - very gourmet. Quite expensive, however, if purchased separately. We had a "pricey" lunch there upon arrival, but it was wonderfully served and delicious. The food had an oriental flair - something unexpected by us, being in Germany. The beds and rooms were quite nice and comfortable, and the staff very helpful. The hotel is across from the Tiergarten which is a wonderful park. Also near a major shopping district and within comfortable walking distance to the subways and busses. I have made arrangements for my family to stay there again this summer when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, indulgent breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: GB1976
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed in this hotel and it has been very consistent. We have always gone for a garden view room, which actually over looks the zoo, so you can see the herons nesting and a few other animals. It is a short walk from the zoo and the main shopping streets, although the nearest station can be a bit dodgy at night. The room isn't that big, but tastefully decorated in a modern but neutral way. The bathroom is lovely, with a feeling of quality about it. There is a cocktail bar on the ground floor which offers some great drinks, which often tend to be ice-heavy, making them poor value for the €9 or so that they cost. They do have a "Liquid Kitchen" section of the menu, with cocktails using basil or tarragon - must be tried! Unless it's included in your roomrate, breakfast is an additional €23 per person, which can really whack up your bill if you stay for a few days. But always feels worth it. As well as ham, cheese, bread, fruit and cooked breakfast, they also can also cook your omelettes or crepes to order. Crepe with nutella being my favourite! There are plenty of staff and the food is frequently replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: garrad
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in great location. Breakfast was very good. Rooms were spacious. Spa was nice too. This hotel is also close to one of the gay areas, so it was very handy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bigbadjoe
Reviews.Content: Sadly we only stayed one night in the hotel as we were making a quick trip over to see the Christmas Markets. The hotel is about 5 min walk from the Zoological Gardens Station and we arrived early in the morning, way to early to check in. We decided to drop our bags at the hotel and the friendly staff assured us that our bags would be waiting for us in our room when we returned later in the afternoon. We had booked a Superior Double Room (Courtyard side) and were not disappointed. The room was quite big, clean and even had an inkjet printer in it should we want to connect it up to a laptop! The bathroom was great, she was impressed by the Roger & Gallet toiletries. Good shower over a nice slightly wider than average bathtub, 2 sets of slippers, but only 1 bathrobe. The bed was in fact 2 singles pushed together with lovely seperate duvets so no nocturnal fighting was needed. Although some people might find them too soft, they were very welcome after a very long day of travelling and shopping. The room itself was a little too warm for our liking so we tried the airconditioning which turned out to be far too noisy. Ah-ha, didn't the hotel website advertise in the list of room facilities: "Windows that open"? Don't be fooled by this one. FIrstly, the aircon turns itself off when you crack open the window (which is a good thing to do), and secondly, cracking open the window is all you can do. The windows open from the top approx 3 inches but it turned out to be sufficient for us and brought the room temperature down to a more acceptable level. We did not eat in the hotel, so sadly cannot comment on the eating facilities or quality thereof.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brandie13
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for everyone. The rooms are really sound proof and roomy. We never heard anyone and were traveling with a baby so it was important. The fitness centre was under construction but it was no trouble to use the Intercontinental across the street. The staff was really friendly all-around. We were really happy with the hotel and the area. Great for shopping of course and quiet street 2 minutes from the zoo and 5 minutes from big-time shopping. Highly Recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable great experience”
Reviews.Author: Janice0324
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Berlin Schweizerhof In the City Center and it was a great choice. We were near the Great Berlin Zoo and the Shopping Street that has so many wonderful shops and Restaurants. We booked a City tour through the Hotel and were picked up at the Hotel and ended our tour nearby. It was a very nice tour of the New Berlin and well narrated with stops at Checkpoint Charlie and The Brandenburg Gate. We were told the History of the new buildings that were rebuilt after the War. The Hotel is very clean, comfortable and quiet and they go out of their way to help with most employee's speaking some English. When we called the Front Desk they answered in English with our Surname which made it easy for us to communicate and anything we ask for we were given immediate attention. The food at the Hotel is excellant and we order a few meals that were not on the menu..If they can accomodate you, they will.. We had a wonderful stay at this Hotel. Janice and Richard Stewart

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tygaman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located opposite the Berlin Zoo and a 5 minute walk from the Zoo Garden station. The room was average size and clean and bright with views over the zoo and across to the Reichstag in the distance. The staff were very friendly, attentive and they could not be faulted. Breakfast was very good, especially the nutella crepes you could order. The hotel also puts out coffee and croissants for people catching early flights out of Berlin from 4am in the morning for no charge which was much appreciated as we flew out of Berlin at 6am. The hotel also had an large indoor pool that was free to use. Overall, the hotel was excellent and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a modern establishment, designed in a contemporary style. The lobby is large and spacious, with plenty of comfortable lounges in case you have to wait to check in. Some apples wait for you at the check in desk if you feel the need to nibble. The staff were very polite and always greet you with a smile. They are very helpful in giving advice on the surrounding area. The room is very chic, continuing the contemporary design in the layout. A plush and comfortable bed awaited us in our room, of which we made instant use. No shortage of space inside, necessary for us since we had so much luggage after spending days of shopping throughout Europe. All the modern conveniences were present in our room and bathroom. The room was clean and maintained by housekeeping to a high standard. The hotel is conveniently located near the Berlin Zoo. The train station is right next to the zoo. For shopaholics like us, the hotel served our needs, as around the corner the KaDeWe department store was nearby, as well as a major shopping strip. The cinemas are also located near the zoo. All you need is here at this hotel and is highly recommended even for tourists in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “All good, superb selection at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-CSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends stayed for three nights and thought the rooms, food, and service all to be excellent. The hotel location is very well placed for public transport, the number 200 bus stops almost outside (the one you need for the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag etc). Zoological train/bus/underground station about a (good) 10 minute walk. We didn't have time to use the pool but did eat in the restaurant and had an excellent meal (they were prepared to let us mix choices from the bar menu and the restaurant menu). The choice from the buffet at breakfast was vast. We also enjoyed the biscuits/chocolates that came when we ordered tea/coffee in the bar. We bought Welcome Travel tickets at the Concierge desk which also came with a booklet for discounts on many attractions. The show at the Friedrichstadtpalast was amazing for its technical effects alone, even if you cannot speak German. Would recommend taking a walking tour of the main parts of the city as we discovered a lot of what you see is not what it seems - some old buildings are less than 20 years old!! Plus our guide gave us lots of hints and tips on further things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pardo
Reviews.Content: I was here for a 3 day conference in April 2007, the hotel being booked centrally by the organisers. Rooms were spacious and comfortable with good quality bathroom and amenities. The top floor had good views over the park and zoo area from my section of the hotel. Food was included in our rate and buffet in style. Breakfast was very good with plenty of selection for all tastes. The location was close to Zoo station for S-Bahn, underground and busses. I would allow 10-15 minutes walk to the station, from where Berlin is very well served by an efficient and regular public transport network. Ku'damm shopping is a similar walk time from the hotel. Staff were multilingual, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Service, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: PrincessRenée
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Dorint Sofitel Schweizerhof. The hotel looked rather understated and plain, not in line with the modern, stylish "Berlin" look . However it made up for that with its excellent service and value. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom clean with great toiletries. We booked the rate that included the breakfast and were thrilled because the breaskfast was delicious, they served Nutella crepes!! Enough said! Room service was superb, I've had the best ever ceasar salad here. After a long day's walk it was great to come back and enjoy the (huge) pool and sauna. Despite the plain and unremarkable look of the spa, the massages were great. I recommend the reflexology massage, divine! The hotel's located on a quiet street near the zoo and aquarium. There's a bus stop right out front and the subway station is 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: I satyed four nights at the hotel for a conference and found it to be a fine establishment. I was in a distant section that made access to the lobby and conference section quite a hike but was near to the spa and pool which proved to be an advantage. The pool is immense and, as a swimmer, was most welcome. The food was tasty and well presented and the location was very convenient for access to lots of transportation and local activities.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, really great service”
Reviews.Author: Cissy113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Berlin film festival in 2006 and managed to get an amazing deal of €80 through the Accor Hotels website. Rooms are in line with what you would expect from a four star hotel: clean, reasonably spacious, modern and with little extras such as bath robes. What really stuck out though was the service at the hotel. We arrived at 9am and were immediately given a room. Obviously, this was only possible because the hotel was not fully booked, but we were still impressed. Also, my friend got sick during our stay and everyone was really helpful, bringing up chicken noodle soup, even though that was not on the room service menu, and their laundry service was also extremely prompt, washing and returning trousers the same evening. Staff at the front desk and the concierge were also helpful. They sell day tickets for public transport right there, which is very convenient. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel that takes you to Potsdamer Platz in about 15 minutes. Though the hotel is in a quiet street, it is only two blocks to the Kurfürstendamm (the main shopping street), which is very convenient, and the underground station is about a 10 minute walk away. In conclusion, this is a very nice hotel that you can often get a very good deal on in a safe neighbourhood. It is close to shopping and public transport, even if it's not really in the middle of things, so if having lots of trendy bars around is important to you, you should probably choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Countryphile
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel – and really good value. Our original stay cost us 89 Euro per night for the 2 of us, including breakfast! The room was clean, with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The breakfast buffet was good since there was something for everyone with a good range of hot and cold items. We had one evening meal in the hotel and, while not cheap, it was the best meal we had while in Berlin. The thing that really made the hotel for me was the staff who were incredibly helpful and accommodating. We were caught up in the recent terror alert and associated flight cancellations. The concierge worked hard to try to get information from the airline for us but we had to go to the airport since all lines were engaged. Our flight was cancelled and we could not get another for 2 days. The staff were very sympathetic to us and it was a relief to have a room back in such a nice hotel. I would definitely stay here again. We did, however, have to pay a higher rate (not the full published rate) when we checked back in but you can’t have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but not sure I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Flydude37
Reviews.Content: Guest rooms and public areas ultra-modern with nice artwork displays. I suppose my average review stems from that fact that I'm American and not used to some of the more European features, so take that into account. Beds are two twins pushed together with only a duvet for cover, but very comfortable. About 30 TV channels, but only one in English (BBC News). Great marble bathrooms, but no shower curtain...just the short piece of glass that extends about halfway across the tub. The large pool is fantastic if you're a swimmer, but the heat and humidity level is atrocious and extends into the gym area. My workout lasted about 3 minutes before I melted into a pile of sweat. If this was April I can't imagine how hot it must get in there in the summer. Possibly just an air-conditioner malfunction, but didn't stop to ask. I bit of a hike to the nearest U-Bahn station (about 10 minutes) but manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: bongoblog
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for 5 nights over Easter and spent the first 2 here. The Lobby and bar ismodern and pleasant though the service to get a drink was very slow. .on going to room the was noone to carry luggage . The room itself was clean and modern but quite small. With the usual facilities. The bathroom was small with hairdryer etc, though the towels were small and coarse. The king bed was 2 singles with flat pillows and no pillow menu and surpringly the bedding wasn't changed daily. After 2 nights I was more than ready to go to the Intercontinental, which is often available for about the same price as the Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town!”
Reviews.Author: LostLagoon
Reviews.Content: We made reservations over a month before we arrived in Berlin. We saw a non-refundable pre-paid (though it wasn't prepaid) 69 euro a night rate on Expedia, and chose this hotel after reading the great reviews on tripadvisor. Budget hotels were not even this cheap in Berlin. While we were travelling, I emailed the hotel to ask for an additional night at that same rate and they happily obliged us, which really impressed me. The hotel is new and very well designed. It is a very modern style, but this is Berlin and a lot of things are modern. The rooms weren't huge, but very comfortable, with good beds, a cabinet with glasses in them, a mini-bar, safe and nice toiletries in the bathroom. The king sized bed we had was two twin beds pushed together, but this was good. We found that on our trip, a lot of hotels didn't even do that. The pool was also very nice, but unlike a lot of hotels I've been to, a lot of people use it, so it's hard to get the pool to yourself. I never quite figured out where the women's changing room is - there was a large room that I thought was the women's changing room, but the saunas were off this room and naked men were occassionally strolling by. There's also a small gym. The breakfasts were 21 or 22 euros, but you can go elsewhere on the Ku'damm which is quite close to the hotel. The hotel internet was also very expensive, but there's an Easy Internet Cafe on Ku'damm (above the Dunkin' Donuts) and another one towards the station. This hotel is about a 10 minute walk (even with large backpacks) from the hotel to the Zoo Bahnhoff. This station will also take you to Schoenefeld airport, and the train we arrived on stopped there, so this was a very convenient location. The staff was nice and professional and the concierge was very helpful. He can sell you subway tickets and help you find your way. The one thing that I didn't like and have a hard time getting used to even if it is very common in Europe, is that people smoke in the lobby. Once, I walked up to the reception desk, and another guest turned around at the same time and practically poked my eye out with a cigarette, which horrified me, but generally, the smoking wasn't bad. I do recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Regular Traveller”
Reviews.Author: arsenieva
Reviews.Content: I have no any coplaints to the hotel. Just on my own individual taste the hotel design is bleak . Large in number squares and right anges (abstractionism style I guess) get me down . But I quite assume that a lot of guests like this style. On the whole: the location is perfect, the rooms are large, the breakfast is variouse... I'd rather recommend the hotel for accommodation..

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE !!”
Reviews.Author: ilockyer
Reviews.Content: I really can't fault this hotel. It is in an excellent location opposite the city zoo and a 5 minute walk to the main shopping area and the nearest U-Bahn (underground metro railway) station. The staff are very friendly. The rooms are first class as was the breakfast. The leisure centre is excellent as well with a huge indoor pool. There is honestly nothing that I could find to criticise.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel at a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: Treemonisha
Reviews.Content: Most of the buzz on Berlin has been about Mitte; the central parts of the former East Berlin. This also applies to the hotel scene. However; the central areas of the former West Berlin also has its advantages; the lower price for the same quality of lodging in central areas being the foremost. The Schweizerhof is a new, large first-class hotel located on the site of the demolished classical Hotel Schweizerhof. The hotel is facing the Tiergarten, just across the street from the Intercontinental. The Bahnhof Zoo is a ten minutes walk away (taxi recommended if carrying luggage!), KaDeWe and heaps of restaurants and shopping opportunities is similarily close. The main gay area of (West-)Berlin, Scöneberg around Nollendorfplatz, is a safe fifteen-minutes stroll away. Budapester Strasse has some through traffic, but is safe and not too noisy. The hotel is a modern hotel with a spacious lobby. It is a typical airline crew layover hotel, used by several European airlines. It claims to have the largest inddor swimmingpool in Berlin. This is part of a health club, most amenities free for hotel guests. The pool is adequate in size, but be aware: semi co-ed! The standard rooms are nice, and well-equipped. Not too large, but sufficient for two. The breakfast buffet is GREAT, but pricey at €20/person. Crêpes and omelettes are made to order, and the selectin on the buffet is opulent, fresh and of high quality. Try and grab a rate which includes breakfast, and bring confirmation that the price quoted DOES include breakfast. We booked on the net and were told when phoning the hotel to confirm arrival times that "ze bed and breakfast rate does not include ze breakfast". Happily, this absurdity was apparent for the hotel when pointed out to them. The standard rate is around €200/night, which isn't bad for Berlin. We stayed for €89 including B&B last easter. We are getting the same rate for a stay next easter, and are going back. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality”
Reviews.Author: khw225
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days and really enjoyed it. The price was also lower than I had feared, knowing this to be a large business hotel. Location is good – you’re close to the Bahnhof Zoo (train station) so you can take trains or the Underground to everywhere easily. It’s a little bit longer of a walk from the Bahnhof than they’ll make you believe, but still reasonable if you can roll your luggage. The room was large and nicely furnished. Internet access and all the other amenities. Everything clean and working well. We even had a nice view over the park. Breakfast was a huge buffet, including hot food cooked to order. Service was consistently friendly. We didn’t get a chance to check out their pool. The only real problem was the shower: the water temperature fluctuated like you wouldn’t believe. I know many hotels have this effect when everyone gets up at the same time, but this was really extreme. I would be happy to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DavidLPortland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Schweizerhof at the beginning of a two week vacation in Germany. We arrived at the hotel in the morning after getting off of a plane from the US. Our room wasn't ready at that time -- as we certainly expected -- and we were told we could check in around 2 pm. We went for a long walk in Berlin, and enjoyed ourselves immensely. We arrived back at the hotel around 3 pm and were first told that our room was not ready and that it would be an unknown period of time before anything more would be known. Another employee, hearing this, took it upon himself to ask us to wait for a few minutes in the lobby, and we watched him work proactively for about 10 minutes, making calls and tracking down the manager on duty, before he loaded our bags onto a trolley and escorted us up to our room. Great to see -- and unfortunately too uncommon -- for someone to take personal responsibility for helping a guest and making something happen. The room was very good -- large by European standards. BTW, the fitness center is now complete, and it is excellent; the pool area in particular is very appealing.

HotelInfo.Name: Pullman Berlin Schweizerhof
HotelInfo.Address: Budapester Strasse 25, 10787 Berlin, Germany
